: Concept Domains - XML Representation

Active as of 2024-03-09

Raw xml | Download



<CodeSystem xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">
  <id value="conceptdomains"/>
  <text>
    <status value="generated"/>
    <div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><p><b>Properties</b></p><p><b>This code system  defines the following properties for its concepts</b></p><table class="grid"><tr><td><b>Code</b></td><td><b>URI</b></td><td><b>Type</b></td><td><b>Description</b></td></tr><tr><td>ConceptualSpaceForClassCode</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#ConceptualSpaceForClassCode</td><td>Coding</td><td>Conceptual Space For ClassCode</td></tr><tr><td>deprecated</td><td>http://hl7.org/fhir/concept-properties#deprecated</td><td>dateTime</td><td>Date when the concept was deprecated.</td></tr><tr><td>DeprecationInfo</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#DeprecationInfo</td><td>string</td><td>Descriptive text about deprecation.</td></tr><tr><td>status</td><td>http://hl7.org/fhir/concept-properties#status</td><td>code</td><td>Status of the domain; retired or deprecated otherwise active.</td></tr><tr><td>HL7usageNotes</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#HL7usageNotes</td><td>string</td><td>HL7 Concept Usage Strength</td></tr><tr><td>contextBindingR1-valueSet</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#contextBindingR1-valueSet</td><td>string</td><td>R1 Bound Strength</td></tr><tr><td>contextBindingUS-valueSet</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#contextBindingUS-valueSet</td><td>string</td><td>US Bound ValueSet</td></tr><tr><td>contextBindingUV-effectiveDate</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#contextBindingUV-effectiveDate</td><td>dateTime</td><td>UV Binding Effective Date</td></tr><tr><td>contextBindingUV-strength</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#contextBindingUV-strength</td><td>code</td><td>UV Binding Coding Strength</td></tr><tr><td>contextBindingUV-valueSet</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#contextBindingUV-valueSet</td><td>string</td><td>UV Bound ValueSet</td></tr><tr><td>contextBindingX1-effectiveDate</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#contextBindingX1-effectiveDate</td><td>dateTime</td><td>X1 Binding Effective Date</td></tr><tr><td>contextBindingX1-strength</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#contextBindingX1-strength</td><td>code</td><td>X1 Binding Coding Strength</td></tr><tr><td>contextBindingX1-valueSet</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#contextBindingX1-valueSet</td><td>string</td><td>X1 Bound ValueSet</td></tr><tr><td>openIssue</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#openIssue</td><td>string</td><td>Open Issue</td></tr><tr><td>source</td><td>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#source</td><td>code</td><td>Source</td></tr><tr><td>synonymCode</td><td>http://hl7.org/fhir/concept-properties#synonym</td><td>code</td><td>An additional concept code that was also attributed to a concept</td></tr></table><p><b>Concepts</b></p><p>This case-sensitive code system <code>http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/conceptdomains</code> defines the following codes in a Is-A heirarchy:</p><table class="codes"><tr><td><b>Lvl</b></td><td style="white-space:nowrap"><b>Code</b></td><td><b>Display</b></td><td><b>Definition</b></td><td><b>Conceptual Space For ClassCode</b></td><td><b>Deprecated</b></td><td><b>Deprecation Informaton</b></td><td><b>status</b></td><td><b>HL7 Concept Usage Notes</b></td><td><b>Parent</b></td><td><b>C1 Binding Effective Date</b></td><td><b>C1 Binding Coding Strength</b></td><td><b>C1 Bound ValueSet</b></td><td><b>R1 Binding Effective Date</b></td><td><b>R1 Binding Coding Strength</b></td><td><b>R1 Bound ValueSet</b></td><td><b>US Binding Effective Date</b></td><td><b>US Binding Coding Strength</b></td><td><b>US Bound ValueSet</b></td><td><b>UV Binding Effective Date</b></td><td><b>UV Binding Coding Strength</b></td><td><b>UV Bound ValueSet</b></td><td><b>X1 Binding Effective Date</b></td><td><b>X1 Binding Coding Strength</b></td><td><b>X1 Bound ValueSet</b></td><td><b>Open Issue</b></td><td><b>Source</b></td><td><b>synonymCode</b></td></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AcknowledgementCondition<a name="conceptdomains-AcknowledgementCondition"> </a></td><td>AcknowledgementCondition</td><td><div><p>Acknowledgement Condition codes describe the conditions under which accept or application level acknowledgements are required to be returned in response to the message send operation.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.155</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AcknowledgementDetailCode<a name="conceptdomains-AcknowledgementDetailCode"> </a></td><td>AcknowledgementDetailCode</td><td><div><p>A site specific code indicating the specific problem being reported by this Ack Detail.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19638</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  AcknowledgementDetailNotSupportedCode<a name="conceptdomains-AcknowledgementDetailNotSupportedCode"> </a></td><td>AcknowledgementDetailNotSupportedCode</td><td><div><p>Refelects rejections because elements of the communication are not supported in the current context.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19640</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  AcknowledgementDetailSyntaxErrorCode<a name="conceptdomains-AcknowledgementDetailSyntaxErrorCode"> </a></td><td>AcknowledgementDetailSyntaxErrorCode</td><td><div><p>Reflects errors in the syntax or structure of the communication.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19639</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AcknowledgementDetailType<a name="conceptdomains-AcknowledgementDetailType"> </a></td><td>AcknowledgementDetailType</td><td><div><p>A code identifying the specific message to be provided.</p>
<p>A textual value may be specified as the print name, or for non-coded messages, as the original text.<em>Discussion:</em></p>
<p>'Required attribute xxx is missing', 'System will be unavailable March 19 from 0100 to 0300'<em>Examples:</em></p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19358</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  AcknowledgmentMessageType<a name="conceptdomains-AcknowledgmentMessageType"> </a></td><td>AcknowledgmentMessageType</td><td><div><p>Identifies the the kind of information specified in the acknowledgement message. Options are: Error, Warning or Information.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AcknowledgementType<a name="conceptdomains-AcknowledgementType"> </a></td><td>AcknowledgementType</td><td><div><p>Acknowledgement code as described in HL7 message processing rules.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.8</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActAppointmentType<a name="conceptdomains-ActAppointmentType"> </a></td><td>ActAppointmentType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of acts that can be scheduled.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Follow-up appointment</li>
<li>New referral appointment</li>
<li>Consultation appointment</li>
<li>Specimen Collection appointment</li>
<li>Procedure appointment</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActClass<a name="conceptdomains-ActClass"> </a></td><td>ActClass</td><td><div><p>A code specifying the major type of Act that this Act-instance represents.</p>
<p><em>Constraints:</em> The classCode domain is a tightly controlled vocabulary, not an external or user-defined vocabulary.</p>
<p>Every Act-instance must have a classCode. If the act class is not further specified, the most general Act.classCode (ACT) is used.</p>
<p>The Act.classCode must be a generalization of the specific Act concept (e.g., as expressed in Act.code), in other words, the Act concepts conveyed in an Act must be specializations of the Act.classCode. Especially, Act.code is not a &quot;modifier&quot; that can alter the meaning of a class code. (See Act.code for contrast.)</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.11527</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActClassExposure<a name="conceptdomains-ActClassExposure"> </a></td><td>ActClassExposure</td><td><div><p>**Description:**The interaction of entities whereupon a subject entity is brought into proximity to a physical, chemical or biological agent. This includes intended exposure (e.g. administering a drug product) as well as accidental or environmental exposure. (Note: This class deals only with proximity and not the effectiveness of the exposure, i.e. not all exposed will suffer actual harm or benefit.)</p>
<p>**Examples:**Exposure to radiation, drug administration, inhalation of peanut aerosol or viral particles.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19832</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActClassGenomicObservation<a name="conceptdomains-ActClassGenomicObservation"> </a></td><td>ActClassGenomicObservation</td><td><div><p>**Description:**An observation of genomic phenomena.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19824</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActClassPolicy<a name="conceptdomains-ActClassPolicy"> </a></td><td>ActClassPolicy</td><td><div><p>**Description:**A mandate, regulation, obligation, requirement, rule, or expectation unilaterally imposed by one party on:</p>
<ul>
<li>The activity of another party</li>
<li>The behavior of another party</li>
<li>The manner in which an act is executed</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19818</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActClassProcedure<a name="conceptdomains-ActClassProcedure"> </a></td><td>ActClassProcedure</td><td><div><p>An Act whose immediate and primary outcome (post-condition) is the alteration of the physical condition of the subject.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> : Procedures may involve the disruption of some body surface (e.g. an incision in a surgical procedure), but they also include conservative procedures such as reduction of a luxated join, chiropractic treatment, massage, balneotherapy, acupuncture, shiatsu, etc. Outside of clinical medicine, procedures may be such things as alteration of environments (e.g. straightening rivers, draining swamps, building dams) or the repair or change of machinery etc.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19665</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActClassStorage<a name="conceptdomains-ActClassStorage"> </a></td><td>ActClassStorage</td><td><div><p>The act of putting something away for safe keeping. The &quot;something&quot; may be physical object such as a specimen, or information, such as observations regarding a specimen.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19664</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  SubjectPhysicalPosition<a name="conceptdomains-SubjectPhysicalPosition"> </a></td><td>SubjectPhysicalPosition</td><td><div><p>The spatial relationship of a subject whether human, other animal, or plant, to a frame of reference such as gravity or a collection device.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ImagingSubjectOrientation<a name="conceptdomains-ImagingSubjectOrientation"> </a></td><td>ImagingSubjectOrientation</td><td><div><p>A code specifying qualitatively the spatial relation between imaged object and imaging film or detector.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SubjectBodyPosition<a name="conceptdomains-SubjectBodyPosition"> </a></td><td>SubjectBodyPosition</td><td><div><p>Contains codes for defining the observed, physical position of a subject, such as during an observation, assessment, collection of a specimen, etc. ECG waveforms and vital signs, such as blood pressure, are two examples where a general, observed position typically needs to be noted.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19798</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCode"> </a></td><td>ActCode</td><td><div><p>The table that provides the detailed or rich codes for the Act classes.</p>
<p><em>Open Issue:</em> The hierarchy has issues and several of the existing domains may be moved under this new one; this must be examined and a proposal to clean up the hierarncy in the near future is needed</p>
<p><em>Open Issue:</em> The description of this domain seems odd and may be a leftover from long ago and needs improvement.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActAccountType<a name="conceptdomains-ActAccountType"> </a></td><td>ActAccountType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of representation groupings of financial transactions that are tracked and reported together with a single balance.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Patient billing accounts</li>
<li>Cost center</li>
<li>Cash</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ACCT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14809</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActAdjudicationType<a name="conceptdomains-ActAdjudicationType"> </a></td><td>ActAdjudicationType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of responses that will occur as a result of the adjudication of an electronic invoice at a summary level and provides guidance on interpretation of the referenced adjudication results.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ul>
<li>adjudicated with adjustments</li>
<li>adjudicated as refused</li>
<li>adjudicated as submitted</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ADJUD</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.17616</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActAdjudicationInformationCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActAdjudicationInformationCode"> </a></td><td>ActAdjudicationInformationCode</td><td><div><p>Explanatory codes that provide information derived by an Adjudicator during the course of adjudicating an Invoice. Codes from this domain are purely information and do not materially affect the adjudicated Invoice. That is, codes do not impact or explain financial adjustments to an Invoice.</p>
<p>A companion domain (ActAdjudicationReason) includes information reasons which have a financial impact on an Invoice (claim).</p>
<p>Example adjudication information code is 54540 - Patient has reached Plan Maximum for current year.</p>
<p>Codes from this domain further rationalizes ActAdjudicationCodes (e.g. AA - Adjudicated with Adjustment), which are used to describe the process of adjudicating an Invoice.</p>
</div></td><td>ADJUD</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActAdjudicationResultActionType<a name="conceptdomains-ActAdjudicationResultActionType"> </a></td><td>ActAdjudicationResultActionType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Actions to be carried out by the recipient of the Adjudication Result information.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.17472</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActCareProvisionCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCareProvisionCode"> </a></td><td>ActCareProvisionCode</td><td><div><p>**Description:**The type and scope of responsibility taken-on by the performer of the Act for a specific subject of care.</p>
</div></td><td>PCPR</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19789</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActCareProvisionRequestType<a name="conceptdomains-ActCareProvisionRequestType"> </a></td><td>ActCareProvisionRequestType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Concepts identifying different types of referral requests. These concepts identify the general type of care or category of services requested. They are not used to represent the indication or diagnosis which triggered the need for the referral. E.g. Anger management service, Intensive Care service, Orthodontics service.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActCredentialedCareCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCredentialedCareCode"> </a></td><td>ActCredentialedCareCode</td><td><div><p>**Description:**The type and scope of legal and/or professional responsibility taken-on by the performer of the Act for a specific subject of care as described by a credentialing agency, i.e. government or non-government agency. Failure in executing this Act may result in loss of credential to the person or organization who participates as performer of the Act. Excludes employment agreements.</p>
<p>**Example:**Hospital license; physician license; clinic accreditation.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19790</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActCredentialedCareProvisionPersonCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCredentialedCareProvisionPersonCode"> </a></td><td>ActCredentialedCareProvisionPersonCode</td><td><div><p>**Description:**The type and scope of legal and/or professional responsibility taken-on by the performer of the Act for a specific subject of care as described by an agency for credentialing individuals.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19791</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActCredentialedCareProvisionProgramCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCredentialedCareProvisionProgramCode"> </a></td><td>ActCredentialedCareProvisionProgramCode</td><td><div><p>**Description:**The type and scope of legal and/or professional responsibility taken-on by the performer of the Act for a specific subject of care as described by an agency for credentialing programs within organizations.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19792</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActEncounterType<a name="conceptdomains-ActEncounterType"> </a></td><td>ActEncounterType</td><td><div><p>Concepts representing types of patient encounter such as ambulatory encounter, inpatient encounter or emergency encounter.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActEncounterAmbulatoryType<a name="conceptdomains-ActEncounterAmbulatoryType"> </a></td><td>ActEncounterAmbulatoryType</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**A comprehensive term for health care provided in a healthcare facility (e.g. a practitioneraTMs office, clinic setting, or hospital) on a nonresident basis. The term ambulatory usually implies that the patient has come to the location and is not assigned to a bed. Sometimes referred to as an outpatient encounter.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>ActEncounterCode</td><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20356</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActEncounterEmergencyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActEncounterEmergencyType"> </a></td><td>ActEncounterEmergencyType</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**A patient encounter that takes place at a dedicated healthcare service delivery location where the patient receives immediate evaluation and treatment, provided until the patient can be discharged or responsibility for the patient's care is transferred elsewhere (for example, the patient could be admitted as an inpatient or transferred to another facility.)</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>ActEncounterCode</td><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20357</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActEncounterFieldType<a name="conceptdomains-ActEncounterFieldType"> </a></td><td>ActEncounterFieldType</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**A patient encounter that takes place both outside a dedicated service delivery location and outside a patient's residence. Example locations might include an accident site and at a supermarket.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>ActEncounterCode</td><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20358</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActEncounterHomeHealthType<a name="conceptdomains-ActEncounterHomeHealthType"> </a></td><td>ActEncounterHomeHealthType</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**Healthcare encounter that takes place in the residence of the patient or a designee</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>ActEncounterCode</td><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20359</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActEncounterInpatientType<a name="conceptdomains-ActEncounterInpatientType"> </a></td><td>ActEncounterInpatientType</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**A patient encounter where a patient is admitted by a hospital or equivalent facility, assigned to a location where patients generally stay at least overnight and provided with room, board, and continuous nursing service.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>ActEncounterCode</td><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16847</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActEncounterShortStayType<a name="conceptdomains-ActEncounterShortStayType"> </a></td><td>ActEncounterShortStayType</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**An encounter where the patient is admitted to a health care facility for a predetermined length of time, usually less than 24 hours.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>ActEncounterCode</td><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20360</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActEncounterVirtualType<a name="conceptdomains-ActEncounterVirtualType"> </a></td><td>ActEncounterVirtualType</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**A patient encounter where the patient and the practitioner(s) are not in the same physical location. Examples include telephone conference, email exchange, robotic surgery, and televideo conference.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>ActEncounterCode</td><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20361</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      EncounterAccident<a name="conceptdomains-EncounterAccident"> </a></td><td>EncounterAccident</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>
</div></td><td>ENC</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>ActEncounterCode</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActEncounterCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActEncounterCode"> </a></td><td>ActEncounterCode</td><td><div><p>Concepts representing types of patient encounter such as ambulatory encounter, inpatient encounter or emergency encounter. </div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>cda</td><td>ActEncounterType</td></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActCodeProcessStep<a name="conceptdomains-ActCodeProcessStep"> </a></td><td>ActCodeProcessStep</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Codes for general process steps.</p>

<li>etc. <em>(Missing third example)</em></li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>SPCTRT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20340</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActLabProcessCodes<a name="conceptdomains-ActLabProcessCodes"> </a></td><td>ActLabProcessCodes</td><td><div><p>Codes for general laboratory process steps.</p>
</div></td><td>ACT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActInfoPersistCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActInfoPersistCode"> </a></td><td>ActInfoPersistCode</td><td><div><p>The act of storing information to long term storage.</p>
</div></td><td>STORE</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActObservationVerificationCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActObservationVerificationCode"> </a></td><td>ActObservationVerificationCode</td><td><div><p>The act of verifying an observations. The subject act related to the observation verification (act relationship SUBJ) must be an observation (OBS)</p>
</div></td><td>OBS</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActSpecimenAccessionCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActSpecimenAccessionCode"> </a></td><td>ActSpecimenAccessionCode</td><td><div><p>The accession act related to a specimen or group of specimens.</p>
</div></td><td>ACSN</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActSpecimenLabelCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActSpecimenLabelCode"> </a></td><td>ActSpecimenLabelCode</td><td><div><p>The act of printing a specimen label. The printing of a label for a specimen container is a significant act in the workflow for collecting specimens.</p>
</div></td><td>PROC</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActSpecimenManifestCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActSpecimenManifestCode"> </a></td><td>ActSpecimenManifestCode</td><td><div><p>The act of adding a specimen to a transportation manifest. For example a laboratory will pack together in a carton all the specimens to be shipped to a reference lab. An electronic manifest showing all the specimens in the shippment is communicated to the reference lab.</p>
</div></td><td>TRNS</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActSpecimenTransportCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActSpecimenTransportCode"> </a></td><td>ActSpecimenTransportCode</td><td><div><p>Transportation of a specimen.</p>
</div></td><td>TRNS</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      LabResultReportingProcessStepCode<a name="conceptdomains-LabResultReportingProcessStepCode"> </a></td><td>LabResultReportingProcessStepCode</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**Used to identify if a lab result is reported as preliminary, final, or corrected. Provides a consistent way to distinguish the business or reporting status of the lab result.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20339</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActCognitiveProfessionalServiceCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCognitiveProfessionalServiceCode"> </a></td><td>ActCognitiveProfessionalServiceCode</td><td><div><p>Denotes the specific service that has been performed. This is obtained from the professional service catalog pertaining to the discipline of the health service provider. Professional services are generally cognitive in nature and exclude surgical procedures. E.g. Provided training, Provided drug therapy review, Gave smoking-cessation counseling, etc.</p>
</div></td><td>ACT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActConsentType<a name="conceptdomains-ActConsentType"> </a></td><td>ActConsentType</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> The type of consent directive, e.g., to consent or dissent to collect, access, or use in specific ways within an EHRS or for health information exchange; or to disclose health information for purposes such as research.</p>
</div></td><td>CONS</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20551</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActDataConsentType<a name="conceptdomains-ActDataConsentType"> </a></td><td>ActDataConsentType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**The type of data consent directive.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActFinancialParticipationConsentType<a name="conceptdomains-ActFinancialParticipationConsentType"> </a></td><td>ActFinancialParticipationConsentType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**The type of financial participation consent directive.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> The Advanced Beneficiary Notice that Medicare patients consent or dissent to prior to receiving health services in the U.S. \ Current values include consent to financial responsibility (1) if the service is not deemed medically necessary; (2) will self pay for a service; or (3) requests that payer be billed.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActInformationAccessCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActInformationAccessCode"> </a></td><td>ActInformationAccessCode</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The type of health information to which the subject of the information or the subject&amp;#039;s delegate consents or dissents.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>allergy information</li>
<li>medication information</li>
<li>professional services information</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19910</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    AdvanceBeneficiaryNoticeType<a name="conceptdomains-AdvanceBeneficiaryNoticeType"> </a></td><td>AdvanceBeneficiaryNoticeType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong></p>
<p>Represents types of consent that patient must sign prior to receipt of service, which is required for billing purposes.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Advanced beneficiary medically necessity notice.</li>
<li>Advanced beneficiary agreement to pay notice.</li>
<li>Advanced beneficiary requests payer billed.</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>CONS</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActContractType<a name="conceptdomains-ActContractType"> </a></td><td>ActContractType</td><td><div><p>An agreement of obligation between two or more parties that is subject to contractual law and enforcement.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> approvals granted by a regulatory agency; contracts measured in financial terms; insurance coverage contracts.</p>
</div></td><td>CNTRCT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActFinancialContractType<a name="conceptdomains-ActFinancialContractType"> </a></td><td>ActFinancialContractType</td><td><div><p>A type of Act representing a contract whose value is measured in monetary terms.</p>

<ul>
<li>insurance policy</li>
<li>providercontract</li>
<li>billing arrangement</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>FCNTRCT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActCoverageTypeCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCoverageTypeCode"> </a></td><td>ActCoverageTypeCode</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> Set of codes indicating the type of insurance policy or program that pays for the cost of benefits provided to covered parties.</p>
</div></td><td>COV</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19855</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ActCoverageEligibilityConfirmationCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCoverageEligibilityConfirmationCode"> </a></td><td>ActCoverageEligibilityConfirmationCode</td><td><div><p>Indication of eligibility coverage for healthcare service(s) and/or product(s).</p>
</div></td><td>COV</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ActCoverageLimitCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCoverageLimitCode"> </a></td><td>ActCoverageLimitCode</td><td><div><p>Criteria that are applicable to the authorized coverage.</p>
</div></td><td>COV</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          ActCoverageQuantityLimitCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCoverageQuantityLimitCode"> </a></td><td>ActCoverageQuantityLimitCode</td><td><div><p>Maximum amount paid or maximum number of services/products covered; or maximum amount or number covered during a specified time period under the policy or program.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19933</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          ActCoveredPartyLimitCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCoveredPartyLimitCode"> </a></td><td>ActCoveredPartyLimitCode</td><td><div><p>Codes representing the types of covered parties that may receive covered benefits under a policy or program.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>7</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">            ActCoveragePartyLimitGroupCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCoveragePartyLimitGroupCode"> </a></td><td>ActCoveragePartyLimitGroupCode</td><td><div><p>Codes representing the level of coverage provided under the policy or program in terms of the types of entities that may play covered parties based on their personal relationships or employment status.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ActInsurancePolicyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActInsurancePolicyType"> </a></td><td>ActInsurancePolicyType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of insurance coverage legal documentation to cover healthcare costs.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Automobile</li>
<li>Extended healthcare</li>
<li>Worker's compensation</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19350</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ActInsuranceTypeCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActInsuranceTypeCode"> </a></td><td>ActInsuranceTypeCode</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> Set of codes indicating the type of insurance policy. Insurance, in law and economics, is a form of risk management primarily used to hedge against the risk of potential financial loss. Insurance is defined as the equitable transfer of the risk of a potential loss, from one entity to another, in exchange for a premium and duty of care. A policy holder is an individual or an organization enters into a contract with an underwriter which stipulates that, in exchange for payment of a sum of money (a premium), one or more covered parties (insureds) is guaranteed compensation for losses resulting from certain perils under specified conditions. The underwriter analyzes the risk of loss, makes a decision as to whether the risk is insurable, and prices the premium accordingly. A policy provides benefits that indemnify or cover the cost of a loss incurred by a covered party, and may include coverage for services required to remediate a loss. An insurance policy contains pertinent facts about the policy holder, the insurance coverage, the covered parties, and the insurer. A policy may include exemptions and provisions specifying the extent to which the indemnification clause cannot be enforced for intentional tortious conduct of a covered party, e.g., whether the covered parties are jointly or severably insured.</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> In contrast to programs, an insurance policy has one or more policy holders, who own the policy. The policy holder may be the covered party, a relative of the covered party, a partnership, or a corporation, e.g., an employer. A subscriber of a self-insured health insurance policy is a policy holder. A subscriber of an employer sponsored health insurance policy is holds a certificate of coverage, but is not a policy holder; the policy holder is the employer. See CoveredRoleType.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19856</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          ActHealthInsuranceTypeCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActHealthInsuranceTypeCode"> </a></td><td>ActHealthInsuranceTypeCode</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> Set of codes indicating the type of health insurance policy that covers health services provided to covered parties. A health insurance policy is a written contract for insurance between the insurance company and the policyholder, and contains pertinent facts about the policy owner (the policy holder), the health insurance coverage, the insured subscribers and dependents, and the insurer. Health insurance is typically administered in accordance with a plan, which specifies (1) the type of health services and health conditions that will be covered under what circumstances (e.g., exclusion of a pre-existing condition, service must be deemed medically necessary; service must not be experimental; service must provided in accordance with a protocol; drug must be on a formulary; service must be prior authorized; or be a referral from a primary care provider); (2) the type and affiliation of providers (e.g., only allopathic physicians, only in network, only providers employed by an HMO); (3) financial participations required of covered parties (e.g., co-pays, coinsurance, deductibles, out-of-pocket); and (4) the manner in which services will be paid (e.g., under indemnity or fee-for-service health plans, the covered party typically pays out-of-pocket and then file a claim for reimbursement, while health plans that have contractual relationships with providers, i.e., network providers, typically do not allow the providers to bill the covered party for the cost of the service until after filing a claim with the payer and receiving reimbursement).</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19857</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ActProgramTypeCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActProgramTypeCode"> </a></td><td>ActProgramTypeCode</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> A set of codes used to indicate coverage under a program. A program is an organized structure for administering and funding coverage of a benefit package for covered parties meeting eligibility criteria, typically related to employment, health, financial, and demographic status. Programs are typically established or permitted by legislation with provisions for ongoing government oversight. Regulations may mandate the structure of the program, the manner in which it is funded and administered, covered benefits, provider types, eligibility criteria and financial participation. A government agency may be charged with implementing the program in accordance to the regulation. Risk of loss under a program in most cases would not meet what an underwriter would consider an insurable risk, i.e., the risk is not random in nature, not financially measurable, and likely requires subsidization with government funds.</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> Programs do not have policy holders or subscribers. Program eligibles are enrolled based on health status, statutory eligibility, financial status, or age. Program eligibles who are covered parties under the program may be referred to as members, beneficiaries, eligibles, or recipients. Programs risk are underwritten by not for profit organizations such as governmental entities, and the beneficiaries typically do not pay for any or some portion of the cost of coverage. See CoveredPartyRoleType.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19858</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActFinancialTransactionType<a name="conceptdomains-ActFinancialTransactionType"> </a></td><td>ActFinancialTransactionType</td><td><div><p>A type of Act representing any transaction between two accounts whose value is measured in monetary terms.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>patient account transaction</li>
<li>encounter accounttransaction</li>
<li>cost center transaction</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>XACT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActBillingArrangementType<a name="conceptdomains-ActBillingArrangementType"> </a></td><td>ActBillingArrangementType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of provision(s) made for reimbursing for the deliver of healthcare services and/or goods provided by a Provider for one or more occurrence or over a specified period.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Contract</li>
<li>Rostering</li>
<li>Capitation</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.17478</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActDataOperationType<a name="conceptdomains-ActDataOperationType"> </a></td><td>ActDataOperationType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of operations that may be performed on objects. Here, objects are broadly understood as information system-related entities (e.g., devices, files, records, tables, processes, programs, domains) containing or receiving information.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Create</li>
<li>Update</li>
<li>Delete</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Open Issue:</em> This is too restrictive to deal with what CBCC wants.</p>
</div></td><td>CACT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActDataAccessOperationType<a name="conceptdomains-ActDataAccessOperationType"> </a></td><td>ActDataAccessOperationType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of operations that may accomplish access of information. Here, objects are broadly understood as information system-related entities (e.g., devices, files, records, tables, processes, programs, domains) containing or receiving information.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Query</li>
<li>Search</li>
<li>Transport</li>
<li>Send</li>
<li>Receive</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>CACT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActDataCollectionOperationType<a name="conceptdomains-ActDataCollectionOperationType"> </a></td><td>ActDataCollectionOperationType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of operations that may accomplish collection or related management of information. Here, objects are broadly understood as information system-related entities (e.g., devices, files, records, tables, processes, programs, domains) containing or receiving information.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Create</li>
<li>Store</li>
<li>Archive</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>CACT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActDataDisclosureOperationType<a name="conceptdomains-ActDataDisclosureOperationType"> </a></td><td>ActDataDisclosureOperationType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of operations that may accomplish disclosure of information. <p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>

<li>Disclose</li>
<li>Forward</li>
<li>Publish</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>CACT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActDataUseOperationType<a name="conceptdomains-ActDataUseOperationType"> </a></td><td>ActDataUseOperationType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of operations that may accomplish usage of information. Here, objects are broadly understood as information system-related entities (e.g., devices, files, records, tables, processes, programs, domains) containing or receiving information.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Activate</li>
<li>Release</li>
<li>Execute Read</li>
<li>Display</li>
<li>Update</li>

</div></td><td>CACT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActDetectedIssueManagementType<a name="conceptdomains-ActDetectedIssueManagementType"> </a></td><td>ActDetectedIssueManagementType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Issue management types that dealing with detected issue observations.</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> Allows for consistent specification and interpretation of issue management.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16695</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActDisciplinaryActionCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActDisciplinaryActionCode"> </a></td><td>ActDisciplinaryActionCode</td><td><div><p>Includes coded types of actions that can be taken by a supervising entity in response to inappropriate action (or inaction) on the part of a supervised entity.</p>
</div></td><td>DISPACT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActEventCategoryWorkingListType<a name="conceptdomains-ActEventCategoryWorkingListType"> </a></td><td>ActEventCategoryWorkingListType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> List of broad catagorizations of clinical event records.</p>

</div></td><td>INVE</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19397</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActInvoiceDetailCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActInvoiceDetailCode"> </a></td><td>ActInvoiceDetailCode</td><td><div><p>Codes representing a service or product that is being invoiced (billed). Available for the AMA at the address listed for CPT above. These codes are found in Appendix A of CPT 2000 Standard Edition. (CPT 2000 Standard Edition, American Medical Association, Chicago, IL).</p>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        CPT5<a name="conceptdomains-CPT5"> </a></td><td>CPT5</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Physicians Current Procedural Terminology (CPT) Manual is a listing of descriptive terms and identifying codes for reporting medical services and procedures performed by physicians. Available for the AMA at the address listed for CPT above. These codes are found in Appendix A of CPT 2000 Standard Edition. (CPT 2000 Standard Edition, American Medical Association, Chicago, IL).</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        HCPCS<a name="conceptdomains-HCPCS"> </a></td><td>HCPCS</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Health Care Financing Administration Common Procedural Coding System (HCPCS) Codes are procedure identifying codes. HCPCS is Health Care Finance AdministrationaTMs (HFCA) coding scheme to group procedures performed for payment to providers. contains codes for medical equipment, injectable drugs, transportation services, and other services not found in CPT4.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ICD10PCS<a name="conceptdomains-ICD10PCS"> </a></td><td>ICD10PCS</td><td><div><p>**Description:**International Classification of Diseases, 10th Revision, Procedure Coding System (ICD-10-PCS) are procedure identifying codes. ICD-10-PCS describes the classification of inpatient procedures for statistical purposes.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ICD9PCS<a name="conceptdomains-ICD9PCS"> </a></td><td>ICD9PCS</td><td><div><p>**Description:**International Classification of Diseases, 9th Revision, Procedure Coding System (ICD-9-PCS) are procedure identifying codes. ICD-9-PCS describes the classification of inpatient procedures for statistical purposes.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActInvoiceDetailTaxType<a name="conceptdomains-ActInvoiceDetailTaxType"> </a></td><td>ActInvoiceDetailTaxType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of tax associated with billable services or products.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Provincial or State sales tax</li>
<li>Harmonized sales tax</li>
<li>Federal sales tax</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19409</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      HCPCSAccommodationCode<a name="conceptdomains-HCPCSAccommodationCode"> </a></td><td>HCPCSAccommodationCode</td><td><div><p>**Description:**External value set for accommodation types used in the U.S. Health Care Financing Administration (HCFA) Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) including modifiers.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActInvoiceElementSummaryType<a name="conceptdomains-ActInvoiceElementSummaryType"> </a></td><td>ActInvoiceElementSummaryType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of summary information that can be reported by queries dealing with Statement of Financial Activity (SOFA). The summary information is generally used to help resolve balance discrepancies between providers and payors.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ul>
<li>number and total value of payable items;</li>
<li>number and value of same period nullify items;</li>
<li>number and value of prior nullify;</li>
<li>number of non-payable nullify items;</li>
<li>number of pending items;</li>
<li>number of rejected items;</li>
<li>number of adjudicated to zero items;</li>
<li>reimbursement items (e.g., pay patient)</li>
<li>Adjudicated non-payee payable prior-period electronic amount</li>
<li>Adjudicated nullified prior-period electronic amount</li>
<li>Adjudicated refused prior-period electronic amount</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.17522</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActInvoiceAdjudicationPaymentSummaryType<a name="conceptdomains-ActInvoiceAdjudicationPaymentSummaryType"> </a></td><td>ActInvoiceAdjudicationPaymentSummaryType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of grouping of invoice elements (totals, sub-totals), reported through a Payment Advice or a Statement of Financial Activity (SOFA). The code can represent summaries by day, location, payee and other cost elements such as bonus, retroactive adjustment and transaction fees.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19413</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActInvoiceGroupType<a name="conceptdomains-ActInvoiceGroupType"> </a></td><td>ActInvoiceGroupType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of invoice element that is used to assist in describing an Invoice that is either submitted for adjudication or for which is returned on adjudication results.</p>
<p>Invoice elements of this type signify a grouping of one or more children (detail) invoice elements. They do not have intrinsic costing associated with them, but merely reflect the sum of all costing for its immediate children invoice elements.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ul>
<li>CPINV - Clinical product invoice</li>
<li>CSINV- Clinical service invoice</li>
<li>RXDINV - Drug invoice</li>
<li>RXCINV - Compound invoice</li>
<li>CSPINV - Combined service and clinical product invoice</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19398</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActInvoiceOverrideType<a name="conceptdomains-ActInvoiceOverrideType"> </a></td><td>ActInvoiceOverrideType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of responses that will occur as a result of the adjudication of an electronic invoice at a summary level and provides guidance on interpretation of the referenced adjudication results.</p>

<ul>
<li>Re-bill for the professional fee</li>
<li>Good faith override</li>
<li>Wasted Drug</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.17590</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActListCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActListCode"> </a></td><td>ActListCode</td><td><div><p>Provides codes associated with ActClass value of LIST (working list)</p>

</div></td><td>POLICY</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19886</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActPrivacyPolicyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActPrivacyPolicyType"> </a></td><td>ActPrivacyPolicyType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Types of privacy policies that further specify the ActClassPolicy value set e.g. override policy, minor's rights to mask sensitive information policy, opt-in, opt-out policy.</p>

Sibling to ActPrivacyPolicyType and Child of ActPolicyType.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20425</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActPrivacyLawPolicyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActPrivacyLawPolicyType"> </a></td><td>ActPrivacyLawPolicyType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of jurisdictional mandates relating to privacy.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20426</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType"> </a></td><td>ActSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType</td><td><div><p>A sensitivity policy is adopted by an enterprise or group of enterprises (a &quot;policy domain&quot;) through a formal data use agreement that stipulates the value, importance, and vulnerability of information. A sensitivity code representing a sensitivity policy may be associated with criteria such as categories of information or sets of information identifiers (e.g., a value set of clinical codes or branch in a code system hierarchy). These criteria may in turn be used for the Policy Decision Point in a Security Engine. A sensitivity code may be used to set the confidentiality code used on information about Acts and Roles to trigger the security mechanisms required to control how security principals (i.e., a person, a machine, a software application) may act on the information (e.g., collection, access, use, or disclosure). Sensitivity codes are never assigned to the transport or business envelope containing patient specific information being exchanged outside of a policy domain as this would disclose the information intended to be protected by the policy. When sensitive information is exchanged with others outside of a policy domain, the confidentiality code on the transport or business envelope conveys the receiver's responsibilities and indicates the how the information is to be safeguarded without unauthorized disclosure of the sensitive information. This ensures that sensitive information is treated by receivers as the sender intends, accomplishing interoperability without point to point negotiations.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20428</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ActEntityInformationSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActEntityInformationSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType"> </a></td><td>ActEntityInformationSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of Sensitivity policies that may apply to a sensitive attribute on an Entity.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ActInformationSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActInformationSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType"> </a></td><td>ActInformationSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of sensitivity policies that apply to Acts.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ActRoleInformationSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActRoleInformationSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType"> </a></td><td>ActRoleInformationSensitivityPrivacyPolicyType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of sensitivity policies that apply to Roles.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20430</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActSecurityPolicyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActSecurityPolicyType"> </a></td><td>ActSecurityPolicyType</td><td><div><p>Types of security policies that further specify the ActClassPolicy value set.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20444</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActObligationSecurityPolicyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActObligationSecurityPolicyType"> </a></td><td>ActObligationSecurityPolicyType</td><td><div><p>Conveys the mandated workflow action that an information custodian, receiver, or user must perform.</p>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> Per ISO 22600-2, ObligationPolicy instances &quot;are event-triggered and define actions to be performed by manager agent&quot;. Per HL7 Composite Security and Privacy Domain Analysis Model: This value set refers to the action required to receive the permission specified in the privacy rule. Per OASIS XACML, an obligation is an operation specified in a policy or policy that is performed in conjunction with the enforcement of an access control decision.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20445</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActRefrainSecurityPolicyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActRefrainSecurityPolicyType"> </a></td><td>ActRefrainSecurityPolicyType</td><td><div><p>Conveys prohibited actions which an information custodian, receiver, or user is not permitted to perform unless otherwise authorized or permitted under specified circumstances.</p>
<p><em>Usage Notes:</em> ISO 22600-2 species that a Refrain Policy &quot;defines actions the subjects must refrain from performing&quot;. Per HL7 Composite Security and Privacy Domain Analysis Model: May be used to indicate that a specific action is prohibited based on specific access control attributes e.g., purpose of use, information type, user role, etc.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>ISO 22600-2 species that a Refrain Policy &quot;defines actions the subjects must refrain from performing&quot;.  Per HL7 Composite Security and Privacy Domain Analysis Model:  May be used to indicate that a specific action is prohibited based on specific access control attributes e.g., purpose of use, information type, user role, etc.</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20446</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActTrustPolicyType<a name="conceptdomains-ActTrustPolicyType"> </a></td><td>ActTrustPolicyType</td><td><div><p>A mandate, obligation, requirement, rule, or expectation conveyed as security metadata between senders and receivers required to establish the reliability, authenticity, and trustworthiness of their transactions.</p>
<p>Trust security metadata are observation made about aspects of trust applicable to an IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability).</p>
<p>Trust applicable to IT resources is established and maintained in and among security domains, and may be comprised of observations about the domain's trust authority, trust framework, trust policy, trust interaction rules, means for assessing and monitoring adherence to trust policies, mechanisms that enforce trust, and quality and reliability measures of assurance in those mechanisms. [Based on ISO IEC 10181-1 and NIST SP 800-63-2]</p>
<p>For example, identity proofing level of assurance and Trust Framework.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20530</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActPreferenceType<a name="conceptdomains-ActPreferenceType"> </a></td><td>ActPreferenceType</td><td><div><p>Concepts representing a type of preference that can be specified.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Food</li>
<li>Drug</li>
<li>Vegetarian</li>
<li>Sweets</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActProcedureCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActProcedureCode"> </a></td><td>ActProcedureCode</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> An identifying code for healthcare interventions/procedures.</p>
