<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PatientImmunizationRelatedObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-PatientImmunizationRelatedObservationType"> </a></td><td>PatientImmunizationRelatedObservationType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Reporting codes that are related to an immunization event.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20411</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PopulationInclusionObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-PopulationInclusionObservationType"> </a></td><td>PopulationInclusionObservationType</td><td><div><p>Observation types for specifying criteria used to assert that a subject is included in a particular population.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>denominator</li>
<li>numerator</li>
<li>initial population</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20476</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PrescriptionObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-PrescriptionObservationType"> </a></td><td>PrescriptionObservationType</td><td><div><p>Observations specific to a particular prescription to express concepts that cannot be expressed via other modeling approaches.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em>  &quot;Patient Medication On Hand Quantity&quot;, &quot;Patient Medication On Hand Days Supply&quot;, &quot;Patient Expected Supply Run-out Date&quot;, &quot;Percentage Dispensed&quot;.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SecurityObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about an IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability), which may be used to make access control decisions. Security metadata are used in security labels.</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> According to ISO/TS 22600-3:2009(E) A.9.1.7 SECURITY LABEL MATCHING, Security label matching compares the initiatorÃs clearance to the targetÃs security label. All of the following must be true for authorization to be granted:</p>
<ul>
<li>The security policy identifiers shall be identical,</li>
<li>The classification level of the initiator shall be greater than or equal to that of the target (that is, there shall be at least one value in the classification list of the clearance greater than or equal to the classification of the target), and</li>
<li>For each security category in the target label, there shall be a security category of the same type in the initiatorÃs clearance and the initiatorÃs classification level shall dominate that of the target.</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityObservationType concept domain designates a code system used to name a security label field type that may be valued with a &quot;security label tag&quot; such as a code from the securty label tag set &quot;SecurityObservationValue&quot; value set.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20457</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      SecurityCategoryObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityCategoryObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityCategoryObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the category of an IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability), which may be used to make access control decisions. Security category metadata is defined by ISO/IEC 2382-8:1998(E/F)/ T-REC-X.812-1995 as: &quot;A nonhierarchical grouping of sensitive information used to control access to data more finely than with hierarchical security classification alone.&quot;</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> A security category observation supports the requirement to specify the type of IT resource in order to facilitate application of appropriate levels of security according to a range of levels of impact or consequences that might result form the unauthorized disclosure, modification, or use of the information or information system. A resource is assigned to a specific category of information (e.g., privacy, medical, proprietary, financial, investigative, contractor sensitive, security management) defined by an organization or in some instances, by a specific law, Executive Order, directive, policy, or regulation. [FIPS 188]</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Types of security categories include:</p>
<ul>
<li>Compartment: A division of data into isolated blocks with separate security controls for the purpose of reducing risk. (ISO 2382-8). Security label metadata that &quot;segments&quot; an IT resource by indicating that access and use is restricted to members of a defined community or project. (HL7 Healthcare Classification System)</li>
<li>Sensitivity: The characteristic of a resource which implies its value or importance and may include its vulnerability. (ISO 7492-2) Privacy metadata for information perceived as undesirable to share. (HL7 Healthcare Classification System)</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityCategoryObservationType concept domain designates a code system used to name a security label field type that may be valued with a &quot;security label tag&quot; such as a code from the security label tage set &quot;SecurityCategoryObservatonValue&quot; value set.</p>
<p>Codes may be drawn from the union of the following value sets: V:PrivacyPolicyType, V:ActPrivacyLaw, V:ActConsentDirective, V:InformationSensitivityPolicy, V:ActInformationSensitivityPolicy, V:RoleInformationSensitivityPolicy, EntitySensitivityPolicy, and V:ActConsentType. Could be bound R1 to a V:ActUSPrivacyPolicy in a future US Realm.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20459</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      SecurityClassificationObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityClassificationObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityClassificationObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the classification of an IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability), which may be used to make access control decisions. Security classification is defined by ISO/IEC 2382-8:1998(E/F)/ T-REC-X.812-1995 as: &quot;The determination of which specific degree of protection against access the data or information requires, together with a designation of that degree of protection.&quot; Security classification metadata is based on an analysis of applicable policies and the risk of harm to an individual that could result from unauthorized disclosure.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Types of security classification include: HL7 Confidentiality Codes such as very restricted, unrestricted, and normal. Intelligence community examples include top secret, security, and confidential.</p>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityClassificationObservationType concept domain designates a code system used to name a security label field type that may be valued with a &quot;security label tag&quot; such as a code from the security label tag set &quot;SecurityClassificationObservationValue&quot; value set.</p>
<p>Note that an Act or Role may be associated with an Observation coded as SecurityClassificationObservationType with a SecurityClassificationObservationValue coded with a confidentiality code from V:Confidentiality Code to indicate that the confidentiality level indicated by an Act or Role confidentiality attribute has been overridden by the entity responsible for assigning the SecurityClassificationObservationValue. This supports the business requirement for increasing or decreasing the level of confidentiality (classification or declassification) based on parameters beyond the original assignment of an Act or Role confidentiality.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20458</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      SecurityControlObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityControlObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityControlObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the control of an IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability), which may be used to make access control decisions. Security control metadata convey instructions to users and receivers for secure distribution, transmission,and storage; dictate obligations or mandated actions; specify any action prohibited by refrain policy such as dissemination controls; and stipulate the permissible purpose of use of an IT resource.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Types of security control metadata include handling:</p>
<ul>
<li>caveats</li>
<li>dissemination controls</li>
<li>obligations</li>
<li>refrain policies</li>
<li>purpose of use constraints</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityControlObservationType concept domain designates a code system used to name a security label field type that may be valued with a &quot;security label tag&quot; such as a code from the security label tag set &quot;SecurityControlObservationValue&quot; value set. Codes may be drawn from the union of the following value sets: V:SecurityPolicy, V:ObligationiPolicy, V:RefrainPolicy, V:PurposeOfUse, and V:GeneralPurposeOfUse.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20460</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      SecurityIntegrityObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityIntegrityObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityIntegrityObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the integrity of an IT resource (data, information object,service, or system capability), which may be used to make access control decisions.</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> Integrity security label fields support integrity models such as the Biba Integrity Model, the Lipner Full Integrity Model, and the Clar-Wilson Model. The value in the integrity label field indicates the degree of confidence that may be placed in the data and also indicates which measures the data requires for protection from modification and destruction.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Types of security integrity observation metadata, which may value the observation include:</p>
<ul>
<li>Integrity status, which indicates the completeness or workflow status of a resource (data, information object, service, or system capability);</li>
<li>Integrity confidence, which indicates the reliability and trustworthiness of the resource;</li>
<li>Integrity control, which indicates pertinent handling caveats, obligations, refrain policies, and purpose of use for the resource;</li>
<li>Data integrity, which indicate the security mechanisms used to ensure that the accuracy and consistency are preserved regardless of changes made (ISO/IEC DIS 2382-8);</li>
<li>Alteration integrity, which indicate the security mechanisms used for authorized transformations of the resource;</li>
<li>Integrity provenance, which indicates the second-hand origins of a reported or asserted resource.</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityIntegrityObservationType concept domain designates a code system used to name a security label field type that may be valued with a &quot;security label tag&quot; such as a code from the security label tag set &quot;SecurityIntegrityObservationValue&quot; value set.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SecurityAlterationIntegrityObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityAlterationIntegrityObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityAlterationIntegrityObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the alteration integrity of an altered IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability), which indicates the mechanism used for authorized transformation of the resource.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Types of security alteration integrity observation metadata, which may value the observation with a code used to indicate the mechanism used for authorized transformation of an IT resource, include:</p>
<ul>
<li>translation</li>
<li>syntactic transformation</li>
<li>semantic mapping</li>
<li>redaction</li>
<li>masking</li>
<li>pseudonymization</li>
<li>anonymization</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityAlterationIntegrityObservationType concept domain designates a code system used to name a security label field type that may be valued with a &quot;security label tag&quot; such as a code from the security label tag set &quot;SecurityAlterationIntegrityObservationValue&quot; value set, which convey the mechanism used for authorized transformation of an IT resource.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20465</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SecurityDataIntegrityObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityDataIntegrityObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityDataIntegrityObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the data integrity of an IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability), which indicates the security mechanism used to preserve resource accuracy and consistency. Data integrity is defined by ISO 22600-23.3.21 as: &quot;The property that data has not been altered or destroyed in an unauthorized manner&quot;, and by ISO/IEC 2382-8: &quot;The property of data whose accuracy and consistency are preserved regardless of changes made.&quot;</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> In accordance with the HL7 RM-ES EHR-FM Profile Standard: The validity of a patient record entry requires an indelible statement (e.g., attestation or electronic signature) by the author(s) of completeness, accuracy, and affirmation that the record cannot be repudiated, assigning each author to his/her actual contributed content.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Types of security data integrity observation metadata, which may value the observation, include:</p>
<ul>
<li>cryptographic hash function</li>
<li>digital signature</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityDataIntegrityObservationType concept domain designates a code system used to name a security label field type that may be valued with a &quot;security label tag&quot; such as a code from the security label tag set &quot;SecurityIntegrityConfidenceObservationValue&quot; value set.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20464</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SecurityIntegrityConfidenceObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityIntegrityConfidenceObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityIntegrityConfidenceObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the integrity confidence of an IT resource (data, information object,service, or system capability) that indicates the reliability or trustworthiness of a resource, which may be used to make access control decisions.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Types of security integrity confidence observation metadata, which may value the observation, include:</p>
<ul>
<li>highly reliable</li>
<li>uncertain reliability</li>
<li>not reliable</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> A security integrity confidence observation on an Act may indicated that a valued Act.uncertainty attribute has been overridden by the entity responsible for assigning the SecurityIntegrityConfidenceObservationValue. This supports the business requirements for increasing or decreasing the assessment of the reliability or trustworthiness of an IT resource based on parameters beyond the original assignment of an Act.uncertaintyCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20463</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SecurityIntegrityProvenanceObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityIntegrityProvenanceObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityIntegrityProvenanceObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the provenance integrity of an IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability), which indicates the lifecycle completeness and workflow status of an IT resource, such as create, modify, append, amend, suspend, archive, and delete; locations in which the resource has been collected or archived, from which it may be retrieved, and the history of its distribution and disclosure. Integrity provenance metadata about an IT resource may be used to assess its veracity, reliability, and trustworthiness.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Types of security integrity provenance observation metadata, which may value the observation with a code used to indicate provenance, include the entity responsible for a report or assertion relayed &quot;second-hand&quot; about an IT resource.</p>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityIntegrityProvenanceObservationType concept domain designates a code system used to name a security label field type that may be valued with a &quot;security label tag&quot; such as a code from the security label tag set &quot;SecurityIntegrityProvenanceObservationValue&quot; value set.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20466</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          SecurityIntegrityProvenanceAssertedByObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityIntegrityProvenanceAssertedByObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityIntegrityProvenanceAssertedByObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the provenance integrity of an IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability), which indicates the entity responsible for an assertion relayed &quot;second-hand&quot; about an IT resource.</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> In accordance with HL7 RM-ES EHR-FM Profile at IN:1.8: If more than one author contributed to the EHR content, then the system shall provide the ability to associate and maintain all authors/contributors with their content.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Types of security integrity provenance asserted by observation metadata, which may value the observation, include assertions about an IT resource by a patient, a clinician, or a device.</p>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityIntegrityProvenanceAssertedByObservationType concept domain designates a code system used to name a security label field type that may be valued with a &quot;security label tag&quot; such as a code from the security label tag set &quot;SecurityIntegrityProvenanceAssertedByObservationValue&quot; value set.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20468</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          SecurityIntegrityProvenanceReportedByObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityIntegrityProvenanceReportedByObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityIntegrityProvenanceReportedByObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the provenance integrity of an IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability), which indicates the entity responsible for a report relayed &quot;second-hand&quot; about an IT resource.</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> In accordance with HL7 RM-ES EHR-FM Profile at IN:1.8: If more than one author contributed to the EHR content, then the system shall provide the ability to associate and maintain all authors/contributors with their content.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Types of security integrity provenance observation metadata, which may value the observation with a code used to indicate provenance, include reports about an IT resource by a patient, a clinician, or a device.</p>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityIntegrityProvenanceReportedByObservationType concept domain designates a code system used to name a security label field type that may be valued with a &quot;security label tag&quot; such as a code from the security label tag set &quot;SecurityIntegrityProvenanceReportedByObservationValue&quot; value set.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20467</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SecurityIntegrityStatusObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityIntegrityStatusObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityIntegrityStatusObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the integrity status of an IT resource (data, information object,service, or system capability), which may be used to make access control decisions. Indicates the completeness or workflow status of an IT resource, which may impact which users that are authorized to access and use the resource.</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> In accordance with the HL7 RM-ES Profile Standard: The validity of a patient record entry requires an indelible statement (e.g., attestation or electronic signature) by the author(s) of completeness, accuracy, and affirmation that the record cannot be repudiated, assigning each author to his/her actual contributed content.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Types of security integrity status observation metadata, which may value the observation, include codes from the HL7 DocumentCompletion value set such as:</p>
<ul>
<li>legally authenticated</li>
<li>in progress</li>
<li>incomplete</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityIntegrityStatusObservationType concept domain designates a code system used to name a security label field type that may be valued with a &quot;security label tag&quot; such as a code from the security label tag set &quot;SecurityIntegrityStatusObservationValue&quot; concept domain, which may be valued with coded concepts from the HL7 DocumentCompletion value set.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20462</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      SecurityTrustObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityTrustObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityTrustObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about aspects of trust applicable to an IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability). Trust applicable to IT resources is established and maintained in and among security domains, and may be comprised of observations about the domain's trust authority, trust framework, trust policy, trust interaction rules, means for assessing and monitoring adherence to trust policies, mechanisms that enforce trust, and quality and reliability measures of assurance in those mechanisms. [Based on ISO IEC 10181-1 and NIST SP 800-63-2]</p>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityTrustObservationType may be used as a trust attribute in a computable trust policy, trust credential, trust assertion, or trust label field in a security label and populated with trust observation values. The valued trust attributes may be used for used for authentication, authorization, and access control decisions. These may also be used to negotiate trust relationships, adjudicate or bridge trust policies, and to specify requirements for participation in a Trust Domain or for asserting compliance with a Trust Framework.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20531</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SecurityTrustAccreditationObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityTrustAccreditationObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityTrustAccreditationObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the formal declaration by an authority or neutral third party that validates the technical, security, trust, and business practice conformance of Trust Agents to facilitate security, interoperability, and trust among participants within a security domain or trust framework.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20532</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SecurityTrustAgreementObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityTrustAgreementObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityTrustAgreementObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about security requirements for a security domain. [ISO IEC 10181-1]</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20537</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SecurityTrustAssuranceObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityTrustAssuranceObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityTrustAssuranceObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about the digital quality or reliability of a trust assertion, activity, capability, information exchange, mechanism, process, or protocol.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20533</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SecurityTrustCertificateObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityTrustCertificateObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityTrustCertificateObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about a set of security-relevant data issued by a security authority or trusted third party, together with security information which is used to provide the integrity and data origin authentication services for an IT resource (data, information object, service, or system capability). [Based on ISO IEC 10181-1]</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20534</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SecurityTrustFrameworkObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityTrustFrameworkObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityTrustFrameworkObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about a complete set of contracts, regulations, or commitments that enable participating actors to rely on certain assertions by other actors to fulfill their information security requirements. [Kantara Initiative]</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20535</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SecurityTrustMechanismObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityTrustMechanismObservationType"> </a></td><td>SecurityTrustMechanismObservationType</td><td><div><p>Type of security metadata observation made about a security architecture system component that supports enforcement of security policies.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20536</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SeverityObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SeverityObservationType"> </a></td><td>SeverityObservationType</td><td><div><p>Categorization of types of observation that capture the interpretation of the result of a laboratory test in terms of normality.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20386</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SimpleMeasurableClinicalObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SimpleMeasurableClinicalObservationType"> </a></td><td>SimpleMeasurableClinicalObservationType</td><td><div><p>Types of measurement observations typically performed in a clinical (non-lab) setting. E.g. Height, Weight, Blood-pressure</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      SimpleMeasurableClinicalObservationComponentType<a name="conceptdomains-SimpleMeasurableClinicalObservationComponentType"> </a></td><td>SimpleMeasurableClinicalObservationComponentType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Represents the components of a measured clinical observation.</p>

<li>ARAC gene</li>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SubstanceCharacteristicObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SubstanceCharacteristicObservationType"> </a></td><td>SubstanceCharacteristicObservationType</td><td><div><p>Distinguishing traits, qualities, or properties given about substances, including chemical structure (as encapsulated data in SMILES, MolFile, InChi), nucleic acid sequence, amino acid sequence, molecular sum formula; molecular mass; stereochemistry and optical activity properties; viscosity; pH, pKa, catalytic activity, etc.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SusceptibilityBatteryType<a name="conceptdomains-SusceptibilityBatteryType"> </a></td><td>SusceptibilityBatteryType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Ensures consistent coding of the susceptibility battery or panel.</p>

<ul>
<li>Bacterial susceptibility panel</li>
<li>Fungal susceptibility panel</li>
<li>Mycobacterial susceptibility panel</li>
<li>Viral susceptibility panel</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>OBS</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SusceptibilityObservationType<a name="conceptdomains-SusceptibilityObservationType"> </a></td><td>SusceptibilityObservationType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Ensures consistent coding of antimicrobial information in the Microbiology lab message.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Ciprofloxacin; Disk Diffusion (Kirby-Bauer)</li>
<li>Vancomycin</li>
<li>Tetracycline; Minimum Inhibitory Concentration</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>OBS</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  RegulationPolicyActType<a name="conceptdomains-RegulationPolicyActType"> </a></td><td>RegulationPolicyActType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A rule set by regulators of product that somehow constrain the use of products. Regulator may be any organization with a mandate to issue such rules, regardless of level, regional, country, state, and local (e.g., an institutional Pharmaceutical and Treatment Committee.)</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Prescription Only</li>
<li>Controlled Substance Schedule II</li>
<li>Standard of Practice</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>POLICY</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20370</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ResearchStudyType<a name="conceptdomains-ResearchStudyType"> </a></td><td>ResearchStudyType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Different types of research studies that may be conducted and reported on.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Observational</li>
<li>Investigational</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>INVSTG</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr style="background-color: #ffeeee"><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  TriggerEventID<a name="conceptdomains-TriggerEventID"> </a></td><td>TriggerEventID</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Trigger Event ID as published in the standard.</p>
<p><em><strong>Deprecation Comment:</strong></em> This Domain has been deprecated as the Domain HL7TriggerEventCode is being used instead, along with its subDomains. Please update designs that refer to this Domain and instead refer to the appropriate Domain in the HL7TriggerEventCode hierarchy.</p>
</div></td><td/><td>2009-04-18</td><td>deprecationEffectiveVersion=866 coremifText=This element was deprecated as of the release indicated.</td><td>deprecated</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActContextLevel<a name="conceptdomains-ActContextLevel"> </a></td><td>ActContextLevel</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Code specifying the level within a hierarchical Act composition structure and the kind of contextual information attached to composite Acts (&quot;containers&quot;) and propagated to component Acts within those containers. The levelCode signifies the position within such a containment hierarchy and the applicable constraints.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> The &quot;extract level&quot; and the &quot;folder level&quot; must contain data about a single individual, whereas the &quot;multiple subject level&quot; may contain data about multiple individuals. While &quot;extract&quot; can originate from multiple sources, a &quot;folder&quot; should originate from a single source. The &quot;composition&quot; level usually has a single author.</p>
<p><em>Constraints:</em> The constraints applicable to a particular level may include differing requirements for participations (e.g. patient, source organization, author or other signatory), relationships to or inclusion of other Acts, documents or use of templates. The constraints pertaining to a level may also specify the permissible levels that may be contained as components of that level. Several nested levels with the same levelCode may be permitted, prohibited (or limited). Instance of the next subordinate level are usually permitted within any level but some levels may be omitted from a model and it may be permissible to skip several layers.</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> The levelCode concepts have been defined to meet specific health record transfer requirements. While these concepts are known to be applicable to some other types of transactions, they are not intended to a be a complete closed list. Options exist for other sets of orthogonal levels where required to meet a business purpose (e.g. a multiple patient communication may be subdivided by a super-ordinate level of subject areas).</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActExposureLevelCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActExposureLevelCode"> </a></td><td>ActExposureLevelCode</td><td><div><p>A qualitative measure of the degree of exposure to the causative agent. This includes concepts such as &quot;low&quot;, &quot;medium&quot; and &quot;high&quot;. This quantifies how the quantity that was available to be administered to the target differs from typical or background levels of the substance.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19939</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActInvoiceElementModifier<a name="conceptdomains-ActInvoiceElementModifier"> </a></td><td>ActInvoiceElementModifier</td><td><div><p>Processing consideration and clarification codes.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.17704</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActMood<a name="conceptdomains-ActMood"> </a></td><td>ActMood</td><td><div><p>A code distinguishing whether an Act is conceived of as a factual statement or in some other manner as a command, possibility, goal, etc.</p>
<p><em>Constraints:</em> An Act-instance must have one and only one moodCode value.</p>
<p>The moodCode of a single Act-instance never changes. Mood is not state.</p>
<p>To describe the progression of a business activity from defined to planned to executed, etc. one must instantiate different Act-instances in the different moods and link them using ActRelationship of general type &quot;sequel&quot;. (See ActRelationship.type.)</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> The Act.moodCode includes the following notions: (1) event, i.e., factual description of an actions that occurred; (2) definition of possible actions and action plans (the master file layer); (3) intent, i.e., an action plan instantiated for a patient as a care plan or order; (4) goal, i.e., an desired outcome attached to patient problems and plans; and (5) criterion, i.e., a predicate used as</p>
<p>The Act.moodCode modifies the meaning of the Act class in a controlled way, just as in natural language, grammatical form of a verb modify the meaning of a sentence in defined ways. For example, if the mood is factual (event,) then the entire act object represents a known fact. If the mood expresses a plan (intent,) the entire act object represents the expectation of what should be done. The mood does not change the meaning of individual act properties in peculiar ways.</p>
<p>Since the mood code is a determining factor for the meaning of an entire Act object, the mood must always be known. This means, whenever an act object is instantiated, the mood attribute must be assigned to a valid code, and the mood assignment can not change throughout the lifetime of an act object.</p>
<p>As the meaning of an act object is factored in the mood code, the mood code affects the interpretation of the entire Act object and with it every property (attributes and associations.) Note that the mood code affects the interpretation of the act object, and the meaning of the act object in turn determines the meaning of the attributes. However, the mood code does not arbitrarily change the meaning of individual attributes.</p>
<p><em>Inert vs. descriptive properties of Acts:</em> Acts have two kinds of act properties, inert and descriptive properties. Inert properties are not affected by the mood, descriptive properties follow the mood of the object. For example, there is an identifier attribute Act.id, which gives a unique identification to an act object. Being a unique identifier for the object is in no way dependent on the mood of the act object. Therefore, the &quot;interpretation&quot; of the Act.id attribute is inert with respect to the act object's mood.</p>
<p>By contrast, most of the Act class' attributes are descriptive for what the Act statement expresses. Descriptive properties of the Act class give answer to the questions who, whom, where, with what, how and when the action is done. The questions who, whom, with what, and where are answered by Participatons, while how and when is answered by descriptive attributes and ActRelationships. The interpretation of a descriptive attribute is aligned to the interpretation of the entire act object, and controlled by the mood.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> To illustrate the effect of mood code, consider a &quot;blood glucose&quot; observation:</p>
<p>The DEFINITION mood specifies the Act of &quot;obtaining blood glucose&quot;. Participations describe in general the characteristics of the people who must be involved in the act, and the required objects, e.g., specimen, facility, equipment, etc. involved. The Observation.value specifies the absolute domain (range) of the observation (e.g., 15-500 mg/dl.)</p>
<p>In INTENT mood the author of the intent expresses the intent that he or someone else &quot;should obtain blood glucose&quot;. The participations are the people actually or supposedly involved in the intended act, especially the author of the intent or any individual assignments for group intents, and the objects actually or supposedly involved in the act (e.g., specimen sent, equipment requirements, etc.) The Observation.value is usually not specified, since the intent is not to measure blood glucose, not to measure blood glucose in a specific range. (But compare with GOAL below.)</p>
<p>In ORDER mood, a kind of intent, the author requests to &quot;please obtain blood glucose&quot;. The Participations are the people actually and supposedly involved in the act, especially the placer and the designated filler, and the objects actually or supposedly involved in the act (e.g., specimen sent, equipment requirements, etc.) The Observation.value is usually not specified, since the order is not to measure blood glucose in a specific range.</p>
<p>In EVENT mood, the author states that &quot;blood glucose was obtained&quot;. Participations are the people actually involved in the act, and the objects actually involved (e.g., specimen, facilities, equipment.) The Observation.value is the value actually obtained (e.g., 80 mg/dL, or &lt;15 mg/dL.)</p>
<p>In event-CRITERION mood, an author considers a certain class of &quot;obtaining blood glucose&quot; possibly with a certain value (range) as outcome. The Participations constrain the criterion, for instance, to a particular patient. The Observation.value is the range in which the criterion would hold (e.g. &gt; 180 mg/dL or 200?300 mg/dL.)</p>
<p>In GOAL mood (a kind of criterion) the author states that &quot;our goal is to be able to obtain blood glucose with the given value (range)&quot;. The Participations are similar to intents, especially the author of the goal and the patient for whom the goal is made. The Observation.value is the range which defined when the goal is met (e.g. 80?120 mg/dl.)</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> The notion of &quot;mood&quot; is borrowed from natural language grammar, the mood of a verb (lat. modus verbi).</p>
<p>The notion of mood also resembles the various extensions of the logic of facts in modal logic and logic with modalities, where the moodCode specifies the modality (fact, possibility, intention, goal, etc.) under which the Act-statement is judged as appropriate or defective.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10196</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActMoodProposal<a name="conceptdomains-ActMoodProposal"> </a></td><td>ActMoodProposal</td><td><div><p>A non-mandated intent to perform an act. Used to record intents that are explicitly not Orders. Professional responsibility for the 'proposal' may or may not be present.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19746</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActPriority<a name="conceptdomains-ActPriority"> </a></td><td>ActPriority</td><td><div><p>A code or set of codes (e.g., for routine, emergency,) specifying the urgency under which the Act happened, can happen, is happening, is intended to happen, or is requested/demanded to happen.</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> This attribute is used in orders to indicate the ordered priority, and in event documentation it indicates the actual priority used to perform the act. In definition mood it indicates the available priorities.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16866</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActEncounterPriority<a name="conceptdomains-ActEncounterPriority"> </a></td><td>ActEncounterPriority</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of priorities to determine start of an encounter.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19457</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActIssuePriority<a name="conceptdomains-ActIssuePriority"> </a></td><td>ActIssuePriority</td><td><div><p>Indicates the importance or priority associated with a detected issue.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19358</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActReason"> </a></td><td>ActReason</td><td><div><p>A code specifying the motivation, cause, or rationale of an Act, when such rationale is not reasonably representable as an ActRelationship of type &quot;has reason&quot; linking to another Act.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> Example reasons that might qualify for being coded in this field might be: &quot;routine requirement&quot;, &quot;infectious disease reporting requirement&quot;, &quot;on patient request&quot;, &quot;required by law&quot;.</p>
<p>Discussion</p>
<p>Most reasons for acts can be clearly expressed by linking the new Act to another prior Act using an ActRelationship of type &quot;has reason&quot;. This simply states that the prior Act is a reason for the new Act (see ActRelationship.) The prior act can then be a specific existing act or a textual explanation. This works for most cases, and the more specific the reason data is, the more should this reason ActRelationship be used instead of the reasonCode.</p>
<p>The reasonCode remains as a place for common reasons that are not related to a prior Act or any other condition expressed in Acts. Indicators that something was required by law or was on the request of a patient etc. may qualify. However, if that piece of legislation, regulation, or the contract or the patient request can be represented as an Act (and they usually can), the reasonCode should not be used.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActAdjudicationReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActAdjudicationReason"> </a></td><td>ActAdjudicationReason</td><td><div><p>Explanatory codes that describe reasons why an Adjudicator has financially adjusted an invoice (claim).</p>
<p>A companion domain (ActAdjudicationInformationCode) includes information reasons which do not have a financial impact on an invoice (claim).</p>
<p>Example adjudication reason code is AA-CLAIM-0011 - Only Basic Procedure/Test Eligible.</p>
<p>Codes from this domain further rationalizes ActAdjudicationCodes (e.g. AA - Adjudicated with Adjustment), which are used to describe the process of adjudicating an invoice. For AS - Adjudicated as Submitted, there should be no specification of ActAdjudicationReason codes, as there are no financial adjustments against the invoice.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActAntigenInvalidReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActAntigenInvalidReason"> </a></td><td>ActAntigenInvalidReason</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Describe why an antigen is considered to be invalid for use.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20409</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActBillableServiceReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActBillableServiceReason"> </a></td><td>ActBillableServiceReason</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> This domain is used to document reasons for providing a billable service; the billable services may include both clinical services and social services.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActBillableClinicalServiceReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActBillableClinicalServiceReason"> </a></td><td>ActBillableClinicalServiceReason</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> May be sent to indicate one or more reasons for the performance of a billable clinical service or product, and not related or specified by a diagnosis.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Duplicate Therapy</li>
<li>Care protocol</li>
<li>Insurance requirement</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      MedicallyNecessaryDuplicateProcedureReason<a name="conceptdomains-MedicallyNecessaryDuplicateProcedureReason"> </a></td><td>MedicallyNecessaryDuplicateProcedureReason</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> This domain is used to document why the procedure is a duplicate of one ordered/charged previously for the same patient within the same date of service and has been determined to be medically necessary.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> A doctor needs a different view in a chest X-Ray.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActBillableNonClinicalServiceReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActBillableNonClinicalServiceReason"> </a></td><td>ActBillableNonClinicalServiceReason</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Maybe sent to indicate one or more reasons for the performance of a non clinical service or product, and not related or specified by diagnosis.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Fraudulent prescription</li>
<li>Patient's preference</li>
<li>Physiotherapy equipment</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      NonClinicalDuplicateServiceReason<a name="conceptdomains-NonClinicalDuplicateServiceReason"> </a></td><td>NonClinicalDuplicateServiceReason</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A duplicate non-clinical service or product is being re-billed.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ul>
<li>Duplicate transportation required for physician visit</li>
<li>Wrong size of a product</li>
<li>Rebuilding wheel chair ramp due to a weather condition</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActCoverageLevelRasonCode<a name="conceptdomains-ActCoverageLevelRasonCode"> </a></td><td>ActCoverageLevelRasonCode</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Represents the reason for the level of coverage provided under the policy or program in terms of the types of entities that may play covered parties based on their personal relationships or employment status.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActCoverageReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActCoverageReason"> </a></td><td>ActCoverageReason</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Codes used to specify reasons or criteria relating to coverage provided under a policy or program. May be used to convey reasons pertaining to coverage contractual provisions, including criteria for eligibility, coverage limitations, coverage maximums, or financial participation required of covered parties.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19871</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActCoverageProviderReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActCoverageProviderReason"> </a></td><td>ActCoverageProviderReason</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Identifies the reason or rationale for coverage of a service or product based on characteristics of the provider, e.g., contractual relationship to payor, such as in or out-of-network; relationship of the covered party to the provider.</p>
<p>**Example:**In closed managed care plan, a covered party is assigned a primary care provider who provides primary care services and authorizes referrals and ancillary and non-primary care services.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActCoverageServiceReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActCoverageServiceReason"> </a></td><td>ActCoverageServiceReason</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Identifies the reason or rationale for coverage of a service or product based on clinical efficacy criteria or practices prescribed by the payor.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    CoverageExclusionReason<a name="conceptdomains-CoverageExclusionReason"> </a></td><td>CoverageExclusionReason</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Identifies the reason or rationale for coverage of a service or product based on coverage exclusions related the risk of adverse selection by covered parties.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    CoverageFinancialParticipationReason<a name="conceptdomains-CoverageFinancialParticipationReason"> </a></td><td>CoverageFinancialParticipationReason</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Identifies the reason or rationale for coverage of a service or product based on financial participation responsibilities of the covered party.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    CoverageLimitationReason<a name="conceptdomains-CoverageLimitationReason"> </a></td><td>CoverageLimitationReason</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Identifies the reason or rationale for limitations on the coverage of a service or product based on coverage contract provisions.</p>
<p>**Example:**The maximum cost per unit; or the maximum number of units per period, which is typically the policy or program effective time.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    EligibilityActReasonCode<a name="conceptdomains-EligibilityActReasonCode"> </a></td><td>EligibilityActReasonCode</td><td><div><p>Identifies the reason or rational for why a person is eligibile for benefits under an insurance policy or progam.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em>  A person is a claimant under an automobile insurance policy are client deceased &amp; adopted client has been given a new policy identifier. A new employee is eligible for health insurance as an employment benefit. A person meets a government program eligibility criteria for financial, age or health status.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19694</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      CoverageEligibilityReason<a name="conceptdomains-CoverageEligibilityReason"> </a></td><td>CoverageEligibilityReason</td><td><div><p>Definition: Identifies the reason or rational for why a person is eligibile for benefits under an insurance policy or progam.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em>  A person is a claimant under an automobile insurance policy are client deceased &amp; adopted client has been given a new policy identifier. A new employee is eligible for health insurance as an employment benefit. A person meets a government program eligibility criteria for financial, age or health status.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19735</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActEncounterReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActEncounterReason"> </a></td><td>ActEncounterReason</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Administration reasons for patient encounters.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19456</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActImmunizationReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActImmunizationReason"> </a></td><td>ActImmunizationReason</td><td><div><p>Reasons why an immunization was administered.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActInformationManagementReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActInformationManagementReason"> </a></td><td>ActInformationManagementReason</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The rationale or purpose for an act relating to information management, such as archiving information for the purpose of complying with an enterprise data retention policy.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActHealthInformationManagementReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActHealthInformationManagementReason"> </a></td><td>ActHealthInformationManagementReason</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The rationale or purpose for an act relating to health information management, such as archiving information for the purpose of complying with an organization policy or jurisdictional law relating to data retention.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20447</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ActConsentInformationAccessOverrideReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActConsentInformationAccessOverrideReason"> </a></td><td>ActConsentInformationAccessOverrideReason</td><td><div><p>To perform one or more operations on information to which the patient has not consented as deemed necessary by authorized entities for providing care in the best interest of the patient; providing immediately needed health care for an emergent condition; or for protecting public or third party safety.</p>
<p><em>Usage Notes:</em> Used to convey the reason that a provider or other entity may or has accessed personal healthcare information. Typically, this involves overriding the subject's consent directives.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>Used to convey the reason that a provider or other entity may or has accessed personal healthcare information. </div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>The rationale or purpose for an act relating to the management of personal health information, such as collecting personal health information for research or public health purposes.</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20449</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ActInformationAccessOverrideReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActInformationAccessOverrideReason"> </a></td><td>ActInformationAccessOverrideReason</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Use to convey the reason that a provider may or has accessed personal healthcare information. </div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19717</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActPaymentReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActPaymentReason"> </a></td><td>ActPaymentReason</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActPreferenceReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActPreferenceReason"> </a></td><td>ActPreferenceReason</td><td><div><p>Reasons why a preference has been specified.</p>

<li>Religious</li>
<li>Request</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActRPSRelatedApplicationReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActRPSRelatedApplicationReason"> </a></td><td>ActRPSRelatedApplicationReason</td><td><div><p>Identifies the reason for citing a related application.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>

<li>Bioequivalence reference</li>
<li>Drug Master File reference</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> This usage is confined to a specific set of requirements related to regulatory documents in the context of RPS documents.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActSupplyFulfillmentRefusalReason<a name="conceptdomains-ActSupplyFulfillmentRefusalReason"> </a></td><td>ActSupplyFulfillmentRefusalReason</td><td><div><p>Indicates why a fulfiller refused to fulfill a supply order, and considered it important to notify other providers of their decision. E.g. &quot;Suspect fraud&quot;, &quot;Possible abuse&quot;, &quot;Contraindicated&quot;.</p>
<p>(used when capturing 'refusal to fill' annotations)</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19718</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ClinicalResearchReason<a name="conceptdomains-ClinicalResearchReason"> </a></td><td>ClinicalResearchReason</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**Contains domains for act reasons used in clinical research.</p>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ClinicalResearchObservationReason<a name="conceptdomains-ClinicalResearchObservationReason"> </a></td><td>ClinicalResearchObservationReason</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**SSpecifies the reason that a test was performed or observation collected in a clinical research study.</p>
<p>**Note:**This set of codes are not strictly reasons, but are used in the currently Normative standard. Future revisions of the specification will model these as ActRelationships and thes codes may subsequently be retired. Thus, these codes should not be used for new specifications.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ControlActReason<a name="conceptdomains-ControlActReason"> </a></td><td>ControlActReason</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Indicates the motivation, cause or rationale of an Act which results in a trigger event.</p>
