</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19784</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PharmacySupplyEventAbortReasonType<a name="conceptdomains-PharmacySupplyEventAbortReasonType"> </a></td><td>PharmacySupplyEventAbortReasonType</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**Identifies why the dispense event was not completed</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20342</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PharmacySupplyEventStockReasonCode<a name="conceptdomains-PharmacySupplyEventStockReasonCode"> </a></td><td>PharmacySupplyEventStockReasonCode</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**A collection of concepts that indicates the reason for a &quot;bulk supply&quot; of medication.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19785</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PharmacySupplyRequestFulfillerRevisionRefusalReasonCode<a name="conceptdomains-PharmacySupplyRequestFulfillerRevisionRefusalReasonCode"> </a></td><td>PharmacySupplyRequestFulfillerRevisionRefusalReasonCode</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**Indicates why the request to transfer a prescription from one dispensing facility to another has been refused.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PharmacySupplyRequestRenewalRefusalReasonCode<a name="conceptdomains-PharmacySupplyRequestRenewalRefusalReasonCode"> </a></td><td>PharmacySupplyRequestRenewalRefusalReasonCode</td><td><div><p>Identifies the reason why a request for a prescription renewal has been refused.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19786</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    StatusRevisionRefusalReasonType<a name="conceptdomains-StatusRevisionRefusalReasonType"> </a></td><td>StatusRevisionRefusalReasonType</td><td><div><p>Indicates why the act revision (status update) is being refused.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20363</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SubstanceAdministrationPermissionRefusalReasonCode<a name="conceptdomains-SubstanceAdministrationPermissionRefusalReasonCode"> </a></td><td>SubstanceAdministrationPermissionRefusalReasonCode</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**Indicates why the requested authorization to prescribe or dispense a medication has been refused.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20343</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SupplyOrderAbortReasonCode<a name="conceptdomains-SupplyOrderAbortReasonCode"> </a></td><td>SupplyOrderAbortReasonCode</td><td><div><p>Indicates why the prescription should no longer be allowed to be dispensed (but can still administer what already has been dispensed).</p>
<p><em>UsageNote:</em> This is typically used in the scenario where the prescription allows for repeats or refills.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19787</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  NonPerformanceReasonCode<a name="conceptdomains-NonPerformanceReasonCode"> </a></td><td>NonPerformanceReasonCode</td><td><div><p>The reason the action was not performed, e.g. why the medication was not taken. If an action was not performed, it is often clinically important to know why the action was not taken.</p>
<p>*Examples:*Patient refused, clinically inappropriate, absolute contraindication etc.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ReasonForNotEvaluatingDevice<a name="conceptdomains-ReasonForNotEvaluatingDevice"> </a></td><td>ReasonForNotEvaluatingDevice</td><td><div><p>Code assigned to indicate the rationale for not performing an evaluation investigation on a device for which a defect has been reported.</p>
<p>Examples include: device received in a condition that made analysis impossible, device evaluation anticipated but not yet begun, device not made by company.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ReferralReasonCode<a name="conceptdomains-ReferralReasonCode"> </a></td><td>ReferralReasonCode</td><td><div><p>The reason a referral was made.</p>
<p>*Examples:*Specialized Medical Assistance, Other Care Requirements.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  RefusalReasonCode<a name="conceptdomains-RefusalReasonCode"> </a></td><td>RefusalReasonCode</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Identifies why a request to add (or activate) a record is being refused. Examples include the receiving system not able to match the identifier and find that record in the receiving system, having no permission, or a detected issue exists which precludes the requested action.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20345</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  SafetyInvestigationReportReasonType<a name="conceptdomains-SafetyInvestigationReportReasonType"> </a></td><td>SafetyInvestigationReportReasonType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Possible reasons generating a report providing information developed during the investigation of an adverse event or a product problem.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Correction</li>
<li>Additional information/Follow-up</li>
<li>Response to regulatory agency request</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  SubstanceAdminSubstitutionNotAllowedReason<a name="conceptdomains-SubstanceAdminSubstitutionNotAllowedReason"> </a></td><td>SubstanceAdminSubstitutionNotAllowedReason</td><td><div><p>Reasons why substitution of a substance administration request is not permitted.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19719</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  SubstanceAdminSubstitutionReason<a name="conceptdomains-SubstanceAdminSubstitutionReason"> </a></td><td>SubstanceAdminSubstitutionReason</td><td><div><p>Indicates the reason for substitution when substitution occurs, or reason for non-substitution when substitution is expected.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19377</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SubstanceAdministrationNoSubstitutionReason<a name="conceptdomains-SubstanceAdministrationNoSubstitutionReason"> </a></td><td>SubstanceAdministrationNoSubstitutionReason</td><td><div><p>Indicates the reason for non-substitution when substitution was expected.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>prescriber request</li>
<li>patient request</li>
<li>continuing therapy (where this latter means that the prescribed item was not substituted, even though &quot;policy&quot; implied it should be, so as not to change from the item that the patient had previously received)</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SubstanceAdministrationPerformedSubstitutionReason<a name="conceptdomains-SubstanceAdministrationPerformedSubstitutionReason"> </a></td><td>SubstanceAdministrationPerformedSubstitutionReason</td><td><div><p>Indicates the reason for substitution when substitution has occurred.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>formulary policy</li>
<li>regulatory requirement</li>
<li>out of stock (where this latter means that the prescribed item was out of stock and an equivalent product was substituted)</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  UpdateRefusalReasonCode<a name="conceptdomains-UpdateRefusalReasonCode"> </a></td><td>UpdateRefusalReasonCode</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Identifies why a request to update to a record is being refused. Examples include the receiving system not able to match the identifier and find that record in the receiving system, having no permission, or a detected issue exists which precludes the requested action.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20346</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActRelationshipCheckpoint<a name="conceptdomains-ActRelationshipCheckpoint"> </a></td><td>ActRelationshipCheckpoint</td><td><div><p>A code specifying when in the course of an Act a precondition for the Act is evaluated (e.g., before the Act starts for the first time, before every repetition, after each repetition but not before the first, or throughout the entire time of the Act.)</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> This attribute is part of the workflow control suite of attributes. An action plan is a composite Act with component Acts. In a sequential plan, each component has a sequenceNumber that specifies the ordering of the plan steps. Before each step is executed and has preconditions these conditions are tested and if the test is positive, the Act has clearance for execution. The repeatNumber may indicate that an Act may be repeatedly executed. The checkpointCode is specifies when the precondition is checked and is analogous to the various conditional statements and loop constructs in programming languages &quot;while-do&quot; vs. &quot;do-while&quot; or &quot;repeat-until&quot; vs. &quot;loop-exit&quot;.</p>
<p>For all checkpointCodes, except &quot;end&quot;, preconditions are being checked at the time when the preceding step of the plan has terminated and this step would be next in the sequence established by the sequenceNumber attribute.</p>
<p>When the checkpointCode for a criterion of a repeatable Act is &quot;end&quot;, the criterion is tested only at the end of each repetition of that Act. When the condition holds true, the next repetition is ready for execution.</p>
<p>When the checkpointCode is &quot;entry&quot; the criterion is checked at the beginning of each repetition (if any) whereas &quot;beginning&quot; means the criterion is checked only once before the repetition &quot;loop&quot; starts.</p>
<p>The checkpointCode &quot;through&quot; is special in that it requires the condition to hold throughout the execution of the Act, even throughout a single execution. As soon as the condition turns false, the Act should receive an interrupt event (see interruptibleInd) and will eventually terminate.</p>
<p>The checkpointCode &quot;exit&quot; is only used on a special plan step that represents a loop exit step. This allows an action plan to exit due to a condition tested inside the execution of this plan. Such exit criteria are sequenced with the other plan components using the ActRelationship.sequenceNumber.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10349</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActRelationshipJoin<a name="conceptdomains-ActRelationshipJoin"> </a></td><td>ActRelationshipJoin</td><td><div><p>A code specifying how concurrent Acts are resynchronized in a parallel branch construct.</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> This attribute is part of the workflow control suite of attributes. An action plan is a composite Act with component Acts. In a sequential plan, each component has a sequenceNumber that specifies the ordering of the plan steps. Branches exist when multiple components have the same sequenceNumber. Branches are parallel if the splitCode specifies that more than one branch can be executed at the same time. The joinCode then specifies if and how the braches are resynchronized.</p>
<p>The principal re-synchronization actions are (1) the control flow waits for a branch to terminate (wait-branch), (2) the branch that is not yet terminated is aborted (kill-branch), (3) the branch is not re-synchronized at all and continues in parallel (detached branch).</p>
<p>A kill branch is only executed if there is at least one active wait (or exclusive wait) branch. If there is no other wait branch active, a kill branch is not started at all (rather than being aborted shortly after it is started.) Since a detached branch is unrelated to all other branches, active detached branches do not protect a kill-branch from being aborted.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10360</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActRelationshipSplit<a name="conceptdomains-ActRelationshipSplit"> </a></td><td>ActRelationshipSplit</td><td><div><p>A code specifying how branches in an action plan are selected among other branches.</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> This attribute is part of the workflow control suite of attributes. An action plan is a composite Act with component Acts. In a sequential plan, each component has a sequenceNumber that specifies the ordering of the plan steps. Branches exist when multiple components have the same sequenceNumber. The splitCode specifies whether a branch is executed exclusively (case-switch) or inclusively, i.e., in parallel with other branches.</p>
<p>In addition to exlusive and inclusive split the splitCode specifies how the pre-condition (also known as &quot;guard conditions&quot; on the branch) are evaluated. A guard condition may be evaluated once when the branching step is entered and if the conditions do not hold at that time, the branch is abandoned. Conversely execution of a branch may wait until the guard condition turns true.</p>
<p>In exclusive wait branches, the first branch whose guard conditions turn true will be executed and all other branches abandoned. In inclusive wait branches some branches may already be executed while other branches still wait for their guard conditions to turn true.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10355</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActRelationshipSubset<a name="conceptdomains-ActRelationshipSubset"> </a></td><td>ActRelationshipSubset</td><td><div><p>Used to indicate that the target of the relationship will be a filtered subset of the total related set of targets.</p>
<p>Used when there is a need to limit the number of components to the first, the last, the next, the total, the average or some other filtered or calculated subset.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19613</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ParticipationSubset<a name="conceptdomains-ParticipationSubset"> </a></td><td>ParticipationSubset</td><td><div><p>Used to indicate that the participation is a filtered subset of the total participations of the same type owned by the Act.</p>
<p>Used when there is a need to limit the participations to the first, the last, the next or some other filtered subset.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19736</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActRelationshipType<a name="conceptdomains-ActRelationshipType"> </a></td><td>ActRelationshipType</td><td><div><p>A code specifying the meaning and purpose of every ActRelationship instance. Each of its values implies specific constraints to what kinds of Act objects can be related and in which way.</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> The types of act relationships fall under one of 5 categories:</p>
<p>1.) (De)-composition, with composite (source) and component (target)</p>
<p>2.) Sequel which includes follow-up, fulfillment, instantiation, replacement, transformation, etc. that all have in common that source and target are Acts of essentially the same kind but with variances in mood and other attributes, and where the target exists before the source and the source refers to the target that it links back to.</p>
<p>3.) Pre-condition, trigger, reason, contraindication, with the conditioned Act at the source and the condition or reason at the target.</p>
<p>4.) Post-condition, outcome, goal and risk, with the Act at the source having the outcome or goal at the target.</p>
<p>5.) A host of functional relationships including support, cause, derivation, etc. generalized under the notion of &quot;pertinence&quot;.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10317</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActRelationshipEntry<a name="conceptdomains-ActRelationshipEntry"> </a></td><td>ActRelationshipEntry</td><td><div><p>Used to enumerate the relationships between a CDA section and its contained entries.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19446</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActRelationshipEntryRelationship<a name="conceptdomains-ActRelationshipEntryRelationship"> </a></td><td>ActRelationshipEntryRelationship</td><td><div><p>Description still needed</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19447</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActRelationshipRelatedOrder<a name="conceptdomains-ActRelationshipRelatedOrder"> </a></td><td>ActRelationshipRelatedOrder</td><td><div><p>Description still needed</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActSite<a name="conceptdomains-ActSite"> </a></td><td>ActSite</td><td><div><p>An anatomical location on an organism which can be the focus of an act.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActBloodDonationSite<a name="conceptdomains-ActBloodDonationSite"> </a></td><td>ActBloodDonationSite</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Sites used for blood donation.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>arm</li>
<li>leg</li>
<li>heel</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  AnimalActSite<a name="conceptdomains-AnimalActSite"> </a></td><td>AnimalActSite</td><td><div><p>An anatomical location on a non-human animal which can be the focus of an act.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  HumanActSite<a name="conceptdomains-HumanActSite"> </a></td><td>HumanActSite</td><td><div><p>An anatomical location on a human which can be the focus of an act.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    HumanSubstanceAdministrationSite<a name="conceptdomains-HumanSubstanceAdministrationSite"> </a></td><td>HumanSubstanceAdministrationSite</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The set of body locations to or through which a substance or product may be administered.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>buttock</li>
<li>left upper arm</li>
<li>bilateral eyes</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19724</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    InjuryActSite<a name="conceptdomains-InjuryActSite"> </a></td><td>InjuryActSite</td><td><div><p>An anatomical location on a human of an injury or disease which is the focus of an act.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActStatus<a name="conceptdomains-ActStatus"> </a></td><td>ActStatus</td><td><div><p>Concepts representing the states in the state-machine of the RIM Act class.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.15933</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ActUncertainty<a name="conceptdomains-ActUncertainty"> </a></td><td>ActUncertainty</td><td><div><p>A code indicating whether the Act statement as a whole, with its subordinate components has been asserted to be uncertain in any way.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> Patient might have had a cholecystectomy procedure in the past (but isn't sure).</p>
<p><em>Constraints:</em> Uncertainty asserted using this attribute applies to the combined meaning of the Act statement established by all descriptive attributes (e.g., Act.code, Act.effectiveTime, Observation.value, SubstanceAdministration.doseQuantity, etc.), and the meanings of any components.</p>
<p>*Discussion:*This is not intended for use to replace or compete with uncertainty associated with a Observation.values alone or other individual attributes of the class. Such pointed indications of uncertainty should be specified by applying the PPD, UVP or UVN data type extensions to the specific attribute. Particularly if the uncertainty is uncertainty of a quantitative measurement value, this must still be represented by a PPD&lt;PQ&gt; in the value and NOT using the uncertaintyCode. Also, when differential diagnoses are enumerated or weighed for probability, the UVP&lt;CD&gt; or UVN&lt;CD&gt; must be used, not the uncertaintyCode. The use of the uncertaintyCode is appropriate only if the entirety of the Act and its dependent Acts is questioned.</p>
<p>Note that very vague uncertainty may be thought related to negationInd, however, the two concepts are really independent. One may be very uncertain about an event, but that does not mean that one is certain about the negation of the event.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16899</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AddressPartType<a name="conceptdomains-AddressPartType"> </a></td><td>AddressPartType</td><td><div><p>Discussion: The hierarchical nature of these concepts shows composition. E.g. &quot;Street Name&quot; is part of &quot;Street Address Line&quot;</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10642</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AdministrativeGender<a name="conceptdomains-AdministrativeGender"> </a></td><td>AdministrativeGender</td><td><div><p>The gender of a person used for adminstrative purposes (as opposed to clinical gender)</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.1</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AttentionKeyword<a name="conceptdomains-AttentionKeyword"> </a></td><td>AttentionKeyword</td><td><div><p>Provides coded key words for attribute AttentionLine.keyWordText, which has data type SC.</p>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10682</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">CaseDetectionMethod<a name="conceptdomains-CaseDetectionMethod"> </a></td><td>CaseDetectionMethod</td><td><div><p>Code for the method by which the public health department was made aware of the case. Includes provider report, patient self-referral, laboratory report, case or outbreak investigation, contact investigation, active surveillance, routine physical, prenatal testing, perinatal testing, prison entry screening, occupational disease surveillance, medical record review, etc.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">Charset<a name="conceptdomains-Charset"> </a></td><td>Charset</td><td><div><p>Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Charset Types</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14853</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">CodingRationale<a name="conceptdomains-CodingRationale"> </a></td><td>CodingRationale</td><td><div><p>Identifies how to interpret the instance of the code, codeSystem value in a set of translations. Since HL7 (or a government body) may mandate that codes from certain code systems be sent in conformant messages, other synonyms that are sent in the translation set need to be distinguished among the originally captured source, the HL7 specified code, or some future role. When this code is NULL, it indicates that the translation is an undefined type. When valued, this property must contain one of the following values:</p>
<p>SRC - Source (or original) code HL7 - HL7 Specified or Mandated SH - both HL7 mandated and the original code (precoordination)</p>
<p>There may be additional values added to this value set as we work through the use of codes in messages and determine other Use Cases requiring special interpretation of the translations.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19250</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">CommunicationFunctionType<a name="conceptdomains-CommunicationFunctionType"> </a></td><td>CommunicationFunctionType</td><td><div><p>Describes the type of communication function that the associated entity plays in the associated transmission.</p>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16170</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">CompressionAlgorithm<a name="conceptdomains-CompressionAlgorithm"> </a></td><td>CompressionAlgorithm</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>

<p><em>Usage Note:</em> Confidentiality codes may be used in security labels and privacy markings to classify IT resources based on sensitivity to indicate the obligation of a custodian or receiver to ensure that the protected resource is not made available or disclosed to individuals, entities, or processes (security principals) unless authorized per applicable policies. Confidentiality codes may also be used in the clearances of initiators requesting access to protected resources.</p>
<p><em>Map:</em> Definition aligns with ISO 7498-2:1989 - Confidentiality is the property that information is not made available or disclosed to unauthorized individuals, entities, or processes.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10228</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ContainerCap<a name="conceptdomains-ContainerCap"> </a></td><td>ContainerCap</td><td><div><p>The type of cap associated with a container</p>

Values may be derived from formal acuity coding schemes such as RBS.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EncounterAdmissionSource<a name="conceptdomains-EncounterAdmissionSource"> </a></td><td>EncounterAdmissionSource</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.12234</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EncounterDischargeDisposition<a name="conceptdomains-EncounterDischargeDisposition"> </a></td><td>EncounterDischargeDisposition</td><td><div><p>A code indicating patient status as of the ending service date of the period covered on this bill, as reported in FL6, Statement Covers Period. Values such as: Discharged to home or self care; Discharged/transferred to SNF, Discharged/transferred to an intermediate care facility (ICF); Expired; Hospice-medical facility. NUBC Form Locator 22</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19453</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EncounterReferralSource<a name="conceptdomains-EncounterReferralSource"> </a></td><td>EncounterReferralSource</td><td><div><p>A code used to define the place or organization responsible for the patient immediately prior to their admission; for example, in the United States, as this is identified in UB-92 Form Locator 20, Source of Adm(ission).</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19454</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EncounterSpecialCourtesy<a name="conceptdomains-EncounterSpecialCourtesy"> </a></td><td>EncounterSpecialCourtesy</td><td><div><p>A code identifying special courtesies extended to the patient. For example, no courtesies, extended courtesies, professional courtesy, VIP courtesies.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.12242</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EntityClass<a name="conceptdomains-EntityClass"> </a></td><td>EntityClass</td><td><div><p>Classifies the Entity class and all of its subclasses. The terminology is hierarchical. At the top is this HL7-defined domain of high-level categories (such as represented by the Entity subclasses). Each of these terms must be harmonized and is specializable.</p>
<p>The value sets beneath are encoded in Entity.code and are drawn from multiple, frequently external, domains that reflect much more fine-grained typing.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10882</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EntityCode<a name="conceptdomains-EntityCode"> </a></td><td>EntityCode</td><td><div><p>A value representing the specific kind of Entity the instance represents.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> A medical building, a Doberman Pinscher, a blood collection tube, a tissue biopsy.</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> For each Entity, the value for this attribute is drawn from one of several coding systems depending on the Entity classCode, such as living subjects (animal and plant taxonomies), chemical substance (e.g., IUPAC code), organizations, insurance company, government agency, hospital, park, lake, syringe, etc. It is possible that Entity.code may be so fine grained that it represents a single instance. An example is the CDC vaccine manufacturer code, modeled as a concept vocabulary, when in fact each concept refers to a single instance.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16040</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  LivingSubjectEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-LivingSubjectEntityType"> </a></td><td>LivingSubjectEntityType</td><td><div><p>Anything that essentially has the property of life, independent of current state (a dead human corpse is still essentially a living subject).</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> persons, animals, trees .</p>
</div></td><td>LIV</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    NonPersonLivingSubjectEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-NonPersonLivingSubjectEntityType"> </a></td><td>NonPersonLivingSubjectEntityType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Types of NonPersonLivingSubjects for the EntityClass &quot;NLIV&quot;</p>
</div></td><td>NLIV</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      AnimalEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-AnimalEntityType"> </a></td><td>AnimalEntityType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A categorizing and grouping mechanism for different types of animal in order to support treatment and reporting. The categories are expected to correspond to a single animal species, or to a related group of species.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Dog</li>
<li>Reptile</li>
<li>Deer</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ANM</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  MaterialEntityClassType<a name="conceptdomains-MaterialEntityClassType"> </a></td><td>MaterialEntityClassType</td><td><div><p>Types of Material for EntityClass &quot;MAT&quot;</p>
</div></td><td>MAT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16041</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ContainerEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-ContainerEntityType"> </a></td><td>ContainerEntityType</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**An object used to hold other entities.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Test tube</li>
<li>Shoe box</li>
<li>Drinking glass</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>CONT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16143</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      HolderEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-HolderEntityType"> </a></td><td>HolderEntityType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Holders are containers that hold other containers or holders.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Tube rack</li>
<li>Specimen carrier</li>
<li>Tray</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>HOLD</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    DeviceGenericType<a name="conceptdomains-DeviceGenericType"> </a></td><td>DeviceGenericType</td><td><div><p>Includes the set of codes used to identify a device that may be referred to in an ICSR report. Example code set reference is the FDA Center for Devices and Radiological Health product code list.</p>
<p>Example product codes include: FOZ = Catheter, Intravascular, Therapeutic, short-term less than 30 days, MOP = Rotator, Prosthetic Heart Valve.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    DrugEntity<a name="conceptdomains-DrugEntity"> </a></td><td>DrugEntity</td><td><div><p>A substance whose therapeutic effect is produced by chemical action within the body.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ClinicalDrug<a name="conceptdomains-ClinicalDrug"> </a></td><td>ClinicalDrug</td><td><div><p>Any substance or mixture of substances manufactured, sold or represented for use in: (a) the diagnosis, treatment, mitigation or prevention of a disease, disorder, abnormal physical state, or its symptoms, in human beings or animals; (b) restoring, correcting or modifying organic functions in human beings or animals.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ActiveIngredientDrugEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-ActiveIngredientDrugEntityType"> </a></td><td>ActiveIngredientDrugEntityType</td><td><div><p>Any substance which, when combined with other ingredients, delivers all or part of the therapeutic benefit associated with a medication.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ActiveMoitySubstanceType<a name="conceptdomains-ActiveMoitySubstanceType"> </a></td><td>ActiveMoitySubstanceType</td><td><div><p>A molecular structure (molecule or part of a molecule) which is the part of the molecule causing the intended pharmacological action. The value set for ActiveMoietySubstanceType may often be a subset of a SubstanceType value set. Candidate value sets are subsets of ChEBI, PubChem CID, CAS Number, InChi Key, and UNII.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Metoprolol (without the succinate or tartrate)</li>
<li>Amoxicillin (anhydrous)</li>
<li>Heparin (ion, without the matching Na or K cation)</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>MMAT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ManufacturedDrug<a name="conceptdomains-ManufacturedDrug"> </a></td><td>ManufacturedDrug</td><td><div><p>Identifies a drug or the use of a drug as produced by a specific manufacturer</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          PackagedDrugProductEntity<a name="conceptdomains-PackagedDrugProductEntity"> </a></td><td>PackagedDrugProductEntity</td><td><div><p>A drug product identified at the level of the package in which it is commonly distributed. Code systems such as UPC (Universal Product Code), NDC (National Drug Code), GTIN(Global Trade Item Number) might be bound to this domain in a given realm.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ExposureAgentEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-ExposureAgentEntityType"> </a></td><td>ExposureAgentEntityType</td><td><div><p>Indicates the material to which the patient was exposed which is believed to be related to the adverse reaction</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      NonDrugAgentEntity<a name="conceptdomains-NonDrugAgentEntity"> </a></td><td>NonDrugAgentEntity</td><td><div><p>Indicates types of allergy and intolerance agents which are non-drugs. (E.g. foods, latex, etc.)</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19699</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ManufacturedMaterialEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-ManufacturedMaterialEntityType"> </a></td><td>ManufacturedMaterialEntityType</td><td><div><p>An Entity or combination of Entities transformed for a particular purpose by a manufacturing process.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> Processed food products, disposable syringes, chemistry analyzer, saline for infusion</p>
</div></td><td>MMAT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      EntityDeviceType<a name="conceptdomains-EntityDeviceType"> </a></td><td>EntityDeviceType</td><td><div><p>A type of manufactured material used in an activity, without being substantially changed through that activity.</p>
</div></td><td>DEV</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        EntityDeviceTrackingTagType<a name="conceptdomains-EntityDeviceTrackingTagType"> </a></td><td>EntityDeviceTrackingTagType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**The specific kind of location-tracking tag.</p>
<p>Examples:</p>
<ul>
<li>RFID</li>
<li>WiFi</li>
<li>Infrared</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>DEV</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        FeedingDeviceType<a name="conceptdomains-FeedingDeviceType"> </a></td><td>FeedingDeviceType</td><td><div><p>A manufactured material that is used during the nutrition process but is not changed via the process.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Disposable Utensils</li>
<li>Plate Guard</li>
<li>Sippy Cup</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      MaskableMaterialEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-MaskableMaterialEntityType"> </a></td><td>MaskableMaterialEntityType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Indicates the types of products whose associated records are allowed to be masked.</p>
</div></td><td>MMAT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    MicroorganismEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-MicroorganismEntityType"> </a></td><td>MicroorganismEntityType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**To be used to identify a microorganism when required by an act.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Escherichia coli</li>
<li>Caulimoviridae</li>
<li>Pseudomonas aeruginosa</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    NutritionalMaterialType<a name="conceptdomains-NutritionalMaterialType"> </a></td><td>NutritionalMaterialType</td><td><div><p>A material that is used to provide nutritional value.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Food</li>
<li>Formula</li>
<li>Supplements</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      FoodType<a name="conceptdomains-FoodType"> </a></td><td>FoodType</td><td><div><p>Concepts that identify raw, cooked or edible substances or ingredients that are intended for consumption by humans or animals to supply nourishment.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Orange</li>
<li>Meat</li>
<li>Milk</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        NutritionalFormulaType<a name="conceptdomains-NutritionalFormulaType"> </a></td><td>NutritionalFormulaType</td><td><div><p>Concepts that identify a type of natural or manufactured food product, typically liquid or powder mixed with water, for complete or supplemental feeding.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Milk-based</li>
<li>Breast-milk</li>
<li>Soy-based</li>
<li>Peptide-based</li>
<li>Elemental</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        NutritionalSupplementType<a name="conceptdomains-NutritionalSupplementType"> </a></td><td>NutritionalSupplementType</td><td><div><p>Concepts that identify a type of natural or manufactured food product used to provide additional nutrients or nourishment replacements beyond those consumed in the normal diet.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>High-calorie</li>
<li>High-protein</li>
<li>Clear liquid</li>
<li>Oral electrolyte Replacement</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      NutrientType<a name="conceptdomains-NutrientType"> </a></td><td>NutrientType</td><td><div><p>Concepts that identify the component source substance (e.g., chemical compound class and/or element) that supply nourishment by providing energy or metabolic support.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Carbohydrates</li>
<li>Protein</li>
<li>Fat</li>
<li>Calcium</li>
<li>Vitamin D</li>
<li>Fiber</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PackagedProductEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-PackagedProductEntityType"> </a></td><td>PackagedProductEntityType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Identifies products such as (1) the GS1 (was UPC and EAN); (2) the U.S., the National Drug Code, which is the U.S. version of what is internationally named the (3) &quot;Medicinal Product Identifier&quot; (MPID). For device products such product code is also known as the &quot;Unique Device Identifier&quot; and may or may not use the GS1 system of product codes. In local contexts the product code can come from local coding systems also, as long as it is a code that denotes to a description of a manufactured product.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>0049-3980-41 (NDC for Geodon Roerig 80 mg capsules 10 capsules x 8 blister packs in a carton)</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>MMAT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ProductEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-ProductEntityType"> </a></td><td>ProductEntityType</td><td><div><p>An identifying data string for healthcare products.</p>
<p>Example code sets include Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) and Universal Product Code (UPC).</p>
</div></td><td>MMAT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      MedicalDeviceType<a name="conceptdomains-MedicalDeviceType"> </a></td><td>MedicalDeviceType</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**A device with direct or indirect therapeutic purpose.</p>
</div></td><td>DEV</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16188</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ProductIngredientSubstanceEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-ProductIngredientSubstanceEntityType"> </a></td><td>ProductIngredientSubstanceEntityType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A type of substance that is used as an ingredient within a product.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Morphine</li>
<li>wheat germ</li>
<li>calcium</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>MMAT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SpecimenAdditiveEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-SpecimenAdditiveEntityType"> </a></td><td>SpecimenAdditiveEntityType</td><td><div><p>**Definition:**Materials introduced to a specimen. These additives may be introduced in order to preserve, maintain or enhance the particular nature or component of the specimen.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Ammonium heparin</li>
<li>Boric Acid</li>
<li>Phenol</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>MAT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16042</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SpecimenEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-SpecimenEntityType"> </a></td><td>SpecimenEntityType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A specimen is defined as a physical entity that is an individual, a group, an item, or a part representative of a larger group, class or whole that is the target of an observation or analysis for the purpose of drawing conclusions about the group, class, or whole. This can be used to code a component of the specimen that the observation diagnosis relates to. Note that any physical entity in the universe has the potential to become a specimen.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Blood</li>
<li>Water</li>
<li>Animal cadaver</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ENT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19464</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      HumanLabSpecimenEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-HumanLabSpecimenEntityType"> </a></td><td>HumanLabSpecimenEntityType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> To be used to code the anatomic component of the human-sourced specimen that the lab observation relates to.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Endometrial biopsy</li>
<li>Thyroid fine needle aspirate</li>
<li>Urine</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ENT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ManufacturedMaterialSpecimenEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-ManufacturedMaterialSpecimenEntityType"> </a></td><td>ManufacturedMaterialSpecimenEntityType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A specimen that is manufactured or a specimen from a manufactured material. This may be a quality control specimen or a manufactured substance.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Quality control specimen</li>
<li>Aspirin</li>
<li>Breakfast sausage</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>MMAT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    VaccineType<a name="conceptdomains-VaccineType"> </a></td><td>VaccineType</td><td><div><p>Types of manufactured material that when administered are intended to confer protection against specific disease(s).</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.228</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  OrganizationEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-OrganizationEntityType"> </a></td><td>OrganizationEntityType</td><td><div><p>Further classifies entities of EntityClass ORG.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>HL7 workgroup</li>
<li>corporation</li>
<li>fraternal organization</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ORG</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    IndividualCaseSafetyReportSenderType<a name="conceptdomains-IndividualCaseSafetyReportSenderType"> </a></td><td>IndividualCaseSafetyReportSenderType</td><td><div><p>A code that is used to indicate the type of organization which is originating and sending the ICSR. The current code example reference is from the International Conference on Harmonisation (ICH) Expert Workgroup guideline on Clinical Safety Data Management: Data Elements for Transmission of Individual Case Safety Reports.</p>
<p>Example concepts are: Pharmaceutical Company, Regulatory Authority, Health Professional, Regional Pharmacovigilence Center, World Health Organization Collaborating Center for International Drug Monitoring.</p>
</div></td><td>ORG</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    VaccineManufacturer<a name="conceptdomains-VaccineManufacturer"> </a></td><td>VaccineManufacturer</td><td><div><p>The manufacturer of a vaccine.</p>
</div></td><td>ORG</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.227</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  PlaceEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-PlaceEntityType"> </a></td><td>PlaceEntityType</td><td><div><p>A physical place or site with its containing structure. May be natural or man-made. The geographic position of a place may or may not be constant.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> dam; city; state.</p>
</div></td><td>PLC</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    NationEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-NationEntityType"> </a></td><td>NationEntityType</td><td><div><p>Codes identifying nation states. Allows for finer grained specification of Entity with classcode &lt;= NAT</p>
<p>*Example:*ISO3166 country codes.</p>
</div></td><td>COUNTRY</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19749</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    TerritoryEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-TerritoryEntityType"> </a></td><td>TerritoryEntityType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A territorial entity that may be cited as the body over which an agency exercises jurisdiction, or which defines a sphere in which a party has a particular responsibility.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>United States</li>
<li>New York</li>
<li>European Union</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>PLC</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ResourceGroupEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-ResourceGroupEntityType"> </a></td><td>ResourceGroupEntityType</td><td><div><p>Codes to characterize a Resource Group using categories that typify its membership and/or function</p>

</div></td><td>RGRP</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19652</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EntityDeterminer<a name="conceptdomains-EntityDeterminer"> </a></td><td>EntityDeterminer</td><td><div><p>EntityDeterminer in natural language grammar is the class of words that comprises articles, demonstrative pronouns, and quantifiers. In the RIM, determiner is a structural code in the Entity class to distinguish whether any given Entity object stands for some, any one, or a specific thing.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10878</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EntityHandling<a name="conceptdomains-EntityHandling"> </a></td><td>EntityHandling</td><td><div><p>Special handling requirements for an Entity.</p>
<p>*Example:*Keep at room temperature; Keep frozen below 0 C; Keep in a dry environment; Keep upright, do not turn upside down.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.13988</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EntityNamePartQualifier<a name="conceptdomains-EntityNamePartQualifier"> </a></td><td>EntityNamePartQualifier</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The qualifier is a set of codes each of which specifies a certain subcategory of the name part in addition to the main name part type. For example, a given name may be flagged as a nickname, a family name may be a pseudonym or a name of public records.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.15888</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EntityNamePartQualifierR2<a name="conceptdomains-EntityNamePartQualifierR2"> </a></td><td>EntityNamePartQualifierR2</td><td><div><p>**Description:**The qualifier is a set of codes each of which specifies a certain subcategory of the name part in addition to the main name part type. For example, a given name may be flagged as a nickname, a family name may be a pseudonym or a name of public records.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20323</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EntityNamePartType<a name="conceptdomains-EntityNamePartType"> </a></td><td>EntityNamePartType</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20322</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EntityNameUse<a name="conceptdomains-EntityNameUse"> </a></td><td>EntityNameUse</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.15913</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  EntityNameSearchUse<a name="conceptdomains-EntityNameSearchUse"> </a></td><td>EntityNameSearchUse</td><td><div><p>A name intended for use in searching or matching</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EntityNameUseR2<a name="conceptdomains-EntityNameUseR2"> </a></td><td>EntityNameUseR2</td><td><div><p>**Description:**A set of codes advising a system or user which name in a set of names to select for a given purpose.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20321</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EntityRisk<a name="conceptdomains-EntityRisk"> </a></td><td>EntityRisk</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Risk associated with the handling of the material.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10405</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EntityStatus<a name="conceptdomains-EntityStatus"> </a></td><td>EntityStatus</td><td><div><p>The status of an instance of the RIM Entity class.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16005</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EquipmentAlertLevel<a name="conceptdomains-EquipmentAlertLevel"> </a></td><td>EquipmentAlertLevel</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10896</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">Ethnicity<a name="conceptdomains-Ethnicity"> </a></td><td>Ethnicity</td><td><div><p>In the United States, federal standards for classifying data on ethnicity determine the categories used by federal agencies and exert a strong influence on categorization by state and local agencies and private sector organizations. The federal standards do not conceptually define ethnicity, and they recognize the absence of an anthropological or scientific basis for ethnicity classification. Instead, the federal standards acknowledge that ethnicity is a social-political construct in which an individual's own identification with a particular ethnicity is preferred to observer identification. The standards specify two minimum ethnicity categories: Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino. The standards define a Hispanic or Latino as a person of &quot;Mexican, Puerto Rican, Cuban, South or Central America, or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race.&quot; The standards stipulate that ethnicity data need not be limited to the two minimum categories, but any expansion must be collapsible to those categories. In addition, the standards stipulate that an individual can be Hispanic or Latino or can be Not Hispanic or Latino, but cannot be both.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain definition does not align with current vocabulary practices and is much too US-centric to be appropriate as a &quot;universal&quot; domain.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.15836</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ExposureMode<a name="conceptdomains-ExposureMode"> </a></td><td>ExposureMode</td><td><div><p>Code for the mechanism by which the exposure agent was exchanged or potentially exchanged by the participants involved in the exposure.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19940</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">GenderStatus<a name="conceptdomains-GenderStatus"> </a></td><td>GenderStatus</td><td><div><p>A value representing whether the primary reproductive organs of NonPersonLivingSubject are present.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.11523</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">GTSAbbreviation<a name="conceptdomains-GTSAbbreviation"> </a></td><td>GTSAbbreviation</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>

These codes will document the ITS type and version for message encoding. The code will appear in the instances based upon rules expressed in the ITS, and do not appear in the abstract message, either as it is presented to received from the ITS.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19449</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">HL7StandardVersionCode<a name="conceptdomains-HL7StandardVersionCode"> </a></td><td>HL7StandardVersionCode</td><td><div><p>This is the domain of HL7 version codes for the Version 3 standards. Values are to be determined by HL7 and added with each new version of the HL7 Standard.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19373</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">HL7UpdateMode<a name="conceptdomains-HL7UpdateMode"> </a></td><td>HL7UpdateMode</td><td><div><p>The possible modes of updating that occur when an attribute is received by a system that already contains values for that attribute.</p>
<p><strong>Open Issue:</strong>  From April 2008 harmonization: &quot;Definition needs to be modified. Make contents to HL7 content mode code system match contents in this table&quot; Clear that this needs to be revisited.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10018</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">HtmlLinkType<a name="conceptdomains-HtmlLinkType"> </a></td><td>HtmlLinkType</td><td><div><p>HtmlLinkType values are drawn from HTML 4.0 and describe the relationship between the current document and the anchor that is the target of the link</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.11017</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">IdentifierReliability<a name="conceptdomains-IdentifierReliability"> </a></td><td>IdentifierReliability</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The identifier was issued by the system responsible for constructing the instance.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20277</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">IdentifierScope<a name="conceptdomains-IdentifierScope"> </a></td><td>IdentifierScope</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Codes to specify the scope in which the identifier applies to the object with which it is associated, and used in the datatype property II.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20276</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">IndustryClassificationSystem<a name="conceptdomains-IndustryClassificationSystem"> </a></td><td>IndustryClassificationSystem</td><td><div><p>North American Industry Classification System(NAICS) for the United States, a new economic classification system that replaces the 1987 Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) for statistical purposes. NAICS is a system for classifying establishments by type of economic activity. Its purposes are: (1) to facilitate the collection, tabulation, presentation, and analysis of data relating to establishments, and (2) to promote uniformity and comparability in the presentation of statistical data describing the economy. NAICS will be used by Federal statistical agencies that collect or publish data by industry. http://www.census.gov/epcd/www/naicsusr.html</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16039</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">IntegrityCheckAlgorithm<a name="conceptdomains-IntegrityCheckAlgorithm"> </a></td><td>IntegrityCheckAlgorithm</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.17385</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">InvoiceElementModifier<a name="conceptdomains-InvoiceElementModifier"> </a></td><td>InvoiceElementModifier</td><td><div><p>Designates a modifier to the code attribute to provide additional information about the invoice element.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> Isolation allowance; After-hours service</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> This is not pre-coordinated into the CD attribute because the modifier code set may not be specifically designed for use with the Act.code code set. This violates the constraint for using the 'modifier' property that the modifier code set must be defined as part of, or specifically for the base code set.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">JobTitleName<a name="conceptdomains-JobTitleName"> </a></td><td>JobTitleName</td><td><div><p>Provides coded names for attribute Employee.jobTitleName, which has data type SC.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">LanguageAbilityMode<a name="conceptdomains-LanguageAbilityMode"> </a></td><td>LanguageAbilityMode</td><td><div><p>A value representing the method of expression of the language.</p>
<p>*Example:*Expressed spoken, expressed written, expressed signed, received spoken, received written, received signed.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.12249</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">LanguageAbilityProficiency<a name="conceptdomains-LanguageAbilityProficiency"> </a></td><td>LanguageAbilityProficiency</td><td><div><p>A value representing the level of proficiency in a language.</p>
<p>*Example:*Excellent, good, fair, poor.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.12199</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ListOwnershipLevel<a name="conceptdomains-ListOwnershipLevel"> </a></td><td>ListOwnershipLevel</td><td><div><p>A dynamic list of individual instances of Act which reflect the needs of an individual worker, team of workers, or an organization to view roups of Acts for clinical or administrative reasons.</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> The grouped Acts are related to the WorkingList via an ActRelationship of type 'COMP' component).</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> Problem lists, goal lists, allergy lists, to-do lists, etc.</p>
<p><em>Design note:</em> This physical class contains but a single attribute, other than those that it inherits from Act. Use of that attribute in the design of RIM-based static models has been <strong>DEPRECATED</strong> in HL7 RIM Harmonization, effective November 2005. This action was based on ecommendations from the Patient Care Technical Committee.</p>
<p>As a consequence, this class will cease to be shown as a physical class in the RIM, once the attribute is retired. Nevertheless, use of this class via an Act.classCode value of 'LIST' is entirely appropriate so long as only the attibutes inherited from Act are used.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">LivingArrangement<a name="conceptdomains-LivingArrangement"> </a></td><td>LivingArrangement</td><td><div><p>A code depicting the living arrangements of a person</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.220</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">LivingSubjectLanguageTypes<a name="conceptdomains-LivingSubjectLanguageTypes"> </a></td><td>LivingSubjectLanguageTypes</td><td><div><p>Types of language sourced from an entity that is a living subject.</p>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.11526</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  HumanLanguage<a name="conceptdomains-HumanLanguage"> </a></td><td>HumanLanguage</td><td><div><p>Codes for the representation of the names of human languages.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.11526</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">LocalMarkupIgnore<a name="conceptdomains-LocalMarkupIgnore"> </a></td><td>LocalMarkupIgnore</td><td><div><p>Tells a receiver to ignore just the local markup tags (local_markup, local_header, local_attr) when value=&quot;markup&quot;, or to ignore the local markup tags and all contained content when value=&quot;all&quot;</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10975</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">LocalRemoteControlState<a name="conceptdomains-LocalRemoteControlState"> </a></td><td>LocalRemoteControlState</td><td><div><p>A value representing the current state of control associated with the device.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> A device can either work autonomously (localRemoteControlStateCode=&quot;Local&quot;) or it can be controlled by another system (localRemoteControlStateCode=&quot;Remote&quot;).</p>
<p><em>Rationale:</em> The control status of a device must be communicated between devices prior to remote commands being transmitted. If the device is not in &quot;Remote&quot; status then external commands will be ignored.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10893</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ManagedParticipationStatus<a name="conceptdomains-ManagedParticipationStatus"> </a></td><td>ManagedParticipationStatus</td><td><div><p>The status of an instance of the RIM Participation class.</p>

The values are patterned after the similar relationships used in the UMLS Metathesaurus. Because the HL7 coding sy</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.11052</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">MaritalStatus<a name="conceptdomains-MaritalStatus"> </a></td><td>MaritalStatus</td><td><div><p>The domestic partnership status of a person.</p>
