</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.12212</td><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.15929</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">MaterialForm<a name="conceptdomains-MaterialForm"> </a></td><td>MaterialForm</td><td><div><p>This identifies the physical state, nature or manifestation of the material.</p>
<p><em>Usage Notes:</em> When the Material class is specialised to Manufactured Material, which it is to routinely to describe Medicinal products and ingredient Substances, and to Containers and Devices, the Material Form attribute is used more explicitly to describe the form and manifestation of these types of concepts - for example for medicinal products, the formCode describes their dose form (tablet, ointment); and for containers, it is their physical type (box, carton, vial).</p>
<p>Examples:</p>
<ul>
<li>Powder</li>
<li>Liquid</li>
<li>Gas</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>When the Material class is specialised to Manufactured Material, which it is to routinely to describe Medicinal products and ingredient Substances, and to Containers and Devices, the Material Form attribute is used more explicitly to describe the form and manifestation of these types of concepts - for example for medicinal products, the formCode describes their dose form (tablet, ointment); and for containers, it is their physical type (box, carton, vial). Examples:  Powder Liquid Gas</td><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19651</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ContainerForm<a name="conceptdomains-ContainerForm"> </a></td><td>ContainerForm</td><td><div><p>Describes the nature (or type) of the container.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Carton</li>
<li>Bottle</li>
<li>Vial</li>
</ul>
<p>**DesignNote:**The material of the container should be separately specified (e.g. the &quot;cardboard&quot; part of cardboard carton or the &quot;glass&quot; part of glass vial should be described elsewhere).</p>
<p>**OpenIssue:**This usage of material form is used in Common Product Model,but it is at variance of what has been done in Specimen where the same information is captured in the Entity.code values. These differences need further study.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  DoseForm<a name="conceptdomains-DoseForm"> </a></td><td>DoseForm</td><td><div><p>**Description:**The physical manifestation &quot;entity&quot; that contains the active and/or inactive ingredients that deliver a dose of medicine (i.e., drug). The key defining characteristics of the dose form can be the state of matter, delivery method, release characteristics, and the administration site or route for which the product is formulated. (Derived from ISO IDMP specification, and SNOMED CT).</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Tablet</li>
<li>Capsule</li>
<li>Oral solution</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    AdministrableDrugForm<a name="conceptdomains-AdministrableDrugForm"> </a></td><td>AdministrableDrugForm</td><td><div><p>Indicates the form in which the drug product should be administered.</p>
<p>This element only needs to be specified when (a) the form in which the drug is measured for dispensing differs from the form in which the drug is administered; and (b) the form in which the quantity of the administered drug being administered is not expressed as a discrete measured mass or volume, e.g. the dose is to be measured in &quot;number of actuations.&quot;</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14570</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td>AdministratableDrugForm</td></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    AdministratableDrugForm<a name="conceptdomains-AdministratableDrugForm"> </a></td><td>AdministratableDrugForm</td><td><div><p>Indicates the form in which the drug product should be administered.</p>
<p>This element only needs to be specified when (a) the form in which the drug is measured for dispensing differs from the form in which the drug is administered; and (b) the form in which the quantity of the administered drug being administered is not expressed as a discrete measured mass or volume, e.g. the dose is to be measured in &quot;number of actuations.&quot; Note that this code is a synonym of AdministrableDrugForm, and is the original misspelling as published in the CDA R2 base; the spelling was corrected in later revisions of V3, but is kept here for backwards compatibility.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14570</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>Seems to be a misspelling of the name of the ConceptDomain from v3; published this way in the CDA R2 base standard.</td><td>cda</td><td>AdministrableDrugForm</td></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    CombinedDoseForm<a name="conceptdomains-CombinedDoseForm"> </a></td><td>CombinedDoseForm</td><td><div><p>The description of this is: &quot;Identifies, as a single concept, a combination dose form description for those products that contain two or more manufactured items in a single authorized product&quot;.</p>
<p><em>Usage Notes:</em> This element needs only to be specified when the product entity describes a complete product that contains two or more manufactured items (sometimes called a combination product or a kit product); it should not be valued for (normal) products which consist of a single manufactured item with a single dose form. The combined dose form describes the orderable (manufactured) dose form of each manufactured item and (if appropriate, separately) the administrable dose form of the pharmaceutical product (as in example one below).</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Powder and solvent for solution for injection</li>
<li>Pessary and vaginal cream</li>
<li>Tablets and capsules</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>This element needs only to be specified when the product entity describes a complete product that contains two or more manufactured items (sometimes called a combination product or a kit product); it should not be valued for (normal) products which consist of a single manufactured item with a single dose form.  The combined dose form describes the orderable (manufactured) dose form of each manufactured item and (if appropriate, separately) the administrable dose form of the pharmaceutical product (as in example one below).</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    OrderableDrugForm<a name="conceptdomains-OrderableDrugForm"> </a></td><td>OrderableDrugForm</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Indicates the form in which the drug product must be, or has been manufactured, or extemporaneous/magistral prepared .</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14411</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">MediaType<a name="conceptdomains-MediaType"> </a></td><td>MediaType</td><td><div><p>Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) Mime Media Types</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14824</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">MessageWaitingPriority<a name="conceptdomains-MessageWaitingPriority"> </a></td><td>MessageWaitingPriority</td><td><div><p>Indicates the highest importance level of the set of messages the acknowledging application has waiting on a queue for the receiving application.</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> These messages would need to be retrieved via a query. This facilitates receiving applications that cannot receive unsolicited messages (i.e. polling). The specific code specified identifies how important the most important waiting message is (and may govern how soon the receiving application is required to poll for the message).</p>
<p>Priority may be used by local agreement to determine the timeframe in which the receiving application is expected to retrieve the messages from the queue.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19581</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ModifyIndicator<a name="conceptdomains-ModifyIndicator"> </a></td><td>ModifyIndicator</td><td><div><p>Indicates whether the subscription to a query is new or is being modified.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.395</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">NullFlavor<a name="conceptdomains-NullFlavor"> </a></td><td>NullFlavor</td><td><div><p>Indication or reason why a valid value is not present.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10609</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ObservationInterpretation<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationInterpretation"> </a></td><td>ObservationInterpretation</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for a categorical assessment of an observation value.</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em>  These interpretation codes are sometimes called &quot;abnormal flags&quot;, however, the judgment of normalcy is just one of the common rough interpretations, and is often not relevant. For example, the susceptibility interpretations are not about &quot;normalcy&quot;, and for any observation of a pathologic condition, it does not make sense to state the normalcy, since pathologic conditions are never considered &quot;normal.&quot;</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.78</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  GeneticObservationInterpretation<a name="conceptdomains-GeneticObservationInterpretation"> </a></td><td>GeneticObservationInterpretation</td><td><div><p>Concepts that specify interpretation of genetic analysis.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>positive</li>
<li>negative</li>
<li>carrier</li>
<li>responsive</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20291</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ObservationInterpretationChange<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationInterpretationChange"> </a></td><td>ObservationInterpretationChange</td><td><div><p>Interpretations of change of quantity and/or severity.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>better</li>
<li>worse</li>
<li>increased</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10214</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ObservationInterpretationDetected<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationInterpretationDetected"> </a></td><td>ObservationInterpretationDetected</td><td><div><p>Interpretations of the presence or absence of a component / analyte or organism in a test or of a sign in a clinical observation. In keeping with laboratory data processing practice, this provides a categorical interpretation of the &quot;meaning&quot; of the quantitative value for the same observation.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20328</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ObservationInterpretationExceptions<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationInterpretationExceptions"> </a></td><td>ObservationInterpretationExceptions</td><td><div><p>Technical exceptions resulting in the inability to provide an interpretation, such as &quot;off scale&quot;. Does not include normality or severity.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10225</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ObservationInterpretationExpectation<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationInterpretationExpectation"> </a></td><td>ObservationInterpretationExpectation</td><td><div><p>Interpretation of the observed result taking into account additional information (contraindicators) about the patient's situation. Concepts in this category are mutually exclusive, i.e., at most one is allowed.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20548</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ObservationInterpretationNormality<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationInterpretationNormality"> </a></td><td>ObservationInterpretationNormality</td><td><div><p>Interpretations of normality or degree of abnormality (including critical or &quot;alert&quot; level). Concepts in this category are mutually exclusive, i.e., at most one is allowed.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10206</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ObservationInterpretationSusceptibility<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationInterpretationSusceptibility"> </a></td><td>ObservationInterpretationSusceptibility</td><td><div><p>Interpretations of anti-microbial susceptibility testing results (microbiology). At most one allowed.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10219</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ReactivityObservationInterpretation<a name="conceptdomains-ReactivityObservationInterpretation"> </a></td><td>ReactivityObservationInterpretation</td><td><div><p>Interpretations of the presence and level of reactivity of the specified component / analyte with the reagent in the performed laboratory test.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20477</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ObservationMethod<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationMethod"> </a></td><td>ObservationMethod</td><td><div><p>A code that provides additional detail about the means or technique used to ascertain the observation.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> Blood pressure measurement method: arterial puncture vs. sphygmomanometer (Riva-Rocci), sitting vs. supine position, etc.</p>
<p><em>Constraints:</em> In all observations the method is already partially specified by the Act.code. In this case, the methodCode NEED NOT be used at all. The methodCode MAY still be used to identify this method more clearly in addition to what is implied from the Act.code. However, an information consumer system or process SHOULD NOT depend on this methodCode information for method detail that is implied by the Act.code.</p>
<p>If the methodCode is used to express method detail that is also implied by the Act.code, the methodCode MUST NOT be in conflict with the implied method of the Act.code.</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> In all observations the method is already partially specified by simply knowing the kind of observation (observation definition, Act.code) and this implicit information about the method does not need to be specified in Observation.methodCode. Particularly, most LOINC codes are defined for specific methods as long as the method makes a practical difference in interpretation. For example, the difference between susceptibility studies using the &quot;minimal inhibitory concentration&quot; (MIC) or the &quot;agar diffusion method&quot; (Kirby-Baur) are specifically assigned to different LOINC codes. The methodCode therefore is only an additional qualifier to specify what may not be known already from the Act.code.</p>
<p>Also, some variances in methods may be tied to the particular device used. The methodCode should not be used to identify the specific device or test-kit material used in the observation. Such information about devices or test-kits should be associated with the observation as &quot;device&quot; participations.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14079</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  AllergyTestObservationMethod<a name="conceptdomains-AllergyTestObservationMethod"> </a></td><td>AllergyTestObservationMethod</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Provides additional methodology information not present in the associated AllergyTestCode term.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  CommonClinicalObservationMethod<a name="conceptdomains-CommonClinicalObservationMethod"> </a></td><td>CommonClinicalObservationMethod</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Used in a patient care message to value simple clinical (non-lab) observation methods, such as found in SOAP (subjective, objective, assessment, plan) progress notes: subjective section (used for history from patient and other informants); objective section (used for physical exam, lab, and other common results), and assessment section (used for the clinicians assessment of the implications of subjective and objective sections).</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  DecisionObservationMethod<a name="conceptdomains-DecisionObservationMethod"> </a></td><td>DecisionObservationMethod</td><td><div><p>Provides codes for decision methods, initially for assessing the causality of events.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19378</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  GeneticObservationMethod<a name="conceptdomains-GeneticObservationMethod"> </a></td><td>GeneticObservationMethod</td><td><div><p>A code that provides additional detail about the means or technique used to ascertain the genetic analysis. Example, PCR, Micro Array.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20290</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  SusceptibilityObservationMethodType<a name="conceptdomains-SusceptibilityObservationMethodType"> </a></td><td>SusceptibilityObservationMethodType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong></p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Disk Diffusion (Kirby-Bauer)</li>
<li>Minimum Inhibitory Concentration</li>
<li>Viral Genotype Susceptibility</li>
<li>Gradient Strip (E-Strip)</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>OBS</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20423</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  VerificationMethod<a name="conceptdomains-VerificationMethod"> </a></td><td>VerificationMethod</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationValue"> </a></td><td>ObservationValue</td><td><div><p>This domain is the root domain to which all HL7-recognized value sets for the Observation.value attribute will be linked when Observation.value has a coded data type.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ActCoverageAssessmentObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-ActCoverageAssessmentObservationValue"> </a></td><td>ActCoverageAssessmentObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Codes specify the category of observation, evidence, or document used to assess for services, e.g., discharge planning, or to establish eligibility for coverage under a policy or program. <p>]</p>
<p>**Examples:**An APGAR result, a functional assessment, etc. The value must not require a specific unit of measure.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  CoverageChemicalDependencyValue<a name="conceptdomains-CoverageChemicalDependencyValue"> </a></td><td>CoverageChemicalDependencyValue</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> The category of addiction used for coverage purposes that may refer to a substance, the consumption of which may result in physical or emotional harm.</p>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20280</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    CoverageItemLimitObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-CoverageItemLimitObservationValue"> </a></td><td>CoverageItemLimitObservationValue</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Coded observation values for types or instances of items for which coverage is provided under a policy or program, e.g., a type of vehicle or a named work of art.</p>

<p>This concept domain is intended to be used as the &quot;value&quot; part of a code/value pair within a generic structure that would convey any sort of information or proof of criteria that is needed to support a special authorization request. For example:</p>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  GeneticObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-GeneticObservationValue"> </a></td><td>GeneticObservationValue</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The domain contains genetic analysis specific observation values, e.g. Homozygote, Heterozygote, etc.</p>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    DiagnosisValue<a name="conceptdomains-DiagnosisValue"> </a></td><td>DiagnosisValue</td><td><div><p>Diagnosis Value</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    OtherIndicationValue<a name="conceptdomains-OtherIndicationValue"> </a></td><td>OtherIndicationValue</td><td><div><p>Indicates an observed reason for a medical action other than an indication or symptom. E.g. Need for a contrast agent prior to a diagnostic image, need for anesthesia prior to surgery, etc.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SymptomValue<a name="conceptdomains-SymptomValue"> </a></td><td>SymptomValue</td><td><div><p>Indicates an observed abnormality in the patientaTMs condition, but does not assert causation. E.g. Runny nose, swelling, flaky skin, etc.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  IndividualCaseSafetyReportValueDomains<a name="conceptdomains-IndividualCaseSafetyReportValueDomains"> </a></td><td>IndividualCaseSafetyReportValueDomains</td><td><div><p>This domain is established as a parent to a variety of value domains being defined to support the communication of Individual Case Safety Reports to regulatory bodies. Arguably, this aggregation is not taxonomically pure, but the grouping will facilitate the management of these domains.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    CaseSeriousnessCriteria<a name="conceptdomains-CaseSeriousnessCriteria"> </a></td><td>CaseSeriousnessCriteria</td><td><div><p>A code that provides information on the overall effect or outcome of the adverse reaction/adverse event reported in the ICSR. Note the criterion applies to the case as a whole and not to an individual reaction.</p>
<p>Example concepts are: death, disability, hospitalization, congenital anomaly/ birth defect, and other medically important condition.</p>
</div></td><td>CASESER</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    DeviceManufacturerEvaluationInterpretation<a name="conceptdomains-DeviceManufacturerEvaluationInterpretation"> </a></td><td>DeviceManufacturerEvaluationInterpretation</td><td><div><p>A code set that includes codes that are used to characterize the outcome of the device evaluation process. The code defines the manufacturer's conclusions following the evaluation.</p>
<p>Examples include: inadequate alarms, device maintenance contributed to event, device failed just prior to use, user error caused event</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    DeviceManufacturerEvaluationMethod<a name="conceptdomains-DeviceManufacturerEvaluationMethod"> </a></td><td>DeviceManufacturerEvaluationMethod</td><td><div><p>Code assigned to indicate a relevant fact within the context of the evaluation of a reported product. There are a number of concept types including the status of the evaluation, the type of evaluation findings, and the type of activity carried out as part of the evaluation process.</p>
<p>Examples include: Actual device involved in incident was evaluated, electrical tests performed, visual examination.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    DeviceManufacturerEvaluationResult<a name="conceptdomains-DeviceManufacturerEvaluationResult"> </a></td><td>DeviceManufacturerEvaluationResult</td><td><div><p>Code assigned to indicate an outcome of the manufacturer's investigation of a product for which a defect has been reported.</p>
<p>Examples include:.component/subassembly failure: air cleaner, computer-, imaging system-, microprocessor-controlled device problem: cache memory, design -- not fail safe.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PertinentReactionRelatedness<a name="conceptdomains-PertinentReactionRelatedness"> </a></td><td>PertinentReactionRelatedness</td><td><div><p>A code to capture the reporter's assessment of the extent to which the reaction is related to the suspect product reported in the ICSR.</p>
<p>Example concepts include: related, not related, possibly related and unlikely related.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ProductCharacterization<a name="conceptdomains-ProductCharacterization"> </a></td><td>ProductCharacterization</td><td><div><p>A code that characterizes the role that the primary reporter felt that the suspect intervention -- either a substance administration or a device related procedure - played in the incident being reported. This code will capture the primary reporter's assessment of the role that the suspect product played in the incident reported in the ICSR.</p>
<p>Examples include: Suspect, Concomitant, Interacting, Re-challenge.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SubjectReaction<a name="conceptdomains-SubjectReaction"> </a></td><td>SubjectReaction</td><td><div><p>A code to capture the kind of reaction that was suffered by the investigated subject, and that is being reported in the ICSR. At this point, SNOMED or MedDRA have been suggested as code systems to be used for providing this information.</p>
<p>Example concepts include hives, swelling, rash, anaphylactic shock.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SubjectReactionEmphasis<a name="conceptdomains-SubjectReactionEmphasis"> </a></td><td>SubjectReactionEmphasis</td><td><div><p>Code that captures the emphasis that the reporter placed on this reaction.</p>
<p>Examples include: highlighted by the reporter, NOT serious, Not highlighted by the reporter, NOT serious, Highlighted by the reporter, SERIOUS, Not highlighted by the reporter, SERIOUS.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SubjectReactionOutcome<a name="conceptdomains-SubjectReactionOutcome"> </a></td><td>SubjectReactionOutcome</td><td><div><p>Code that captures the type of outcome from an individual outcome of a reaction to the suspect product reported in the ICSR.</p>
<p>Examples include: Recovered/resolved. Recovering/resolving, Not recovered/not resolved, Recovered/resolved with sequelae, Fatal.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  InjuryObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-InjuryObservationValue"> </a></td><td>InjuryObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Values for observations of injuries.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  IntoleranceValue<a name="conceptdomains-IntoleranceValue"> </a></td><td>IntoleranceValue</td><td><div><p>Codes identifying pariticular groupings of allergens and other agents which cause allergies and intolerances. E.g. the drug, allergen group, food or environmental agent which triggers the intolerance</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  IsolateObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-IsolateObservationValue"> </a></td><td>IsolateObservationValue</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Used to code and identify the Isolate observation result value when a coded result is reported.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Heavy growth</li>
<li>Scant growth</li>
<li>Moderate growth</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  IssueTriggerObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-IssueTriggerObservationValue"> </a></td><td>IssueTriggerObservationValue</td><td><div><p>The combined domain for different types of coded observation issue triggers, such as diagnoses, allergies, etc.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  KnowledgeSubjectObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-KnowledgeSubjectObservationValue"> </a></td><td>KnowledgeSubjectObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Observation values that document the types of observations belonging to the domain KnowledgeSubjectObservationType.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.11.76</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  KnowledgeSubTopicObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-KnowledgeSubTopicObservationValue"> </a></td><td>KnowledgeSubTopicObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Observation values that document the types of observations belonging to the domain KnowledgeSubTopicObservationType.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.11.77</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  LabResultObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-LabResultObservationValue"> </a></td><td>LabResultObservationValue</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Used to code and identify the laboratory result value when a coded result is reported.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Sickle cell trait</li>
<li>Hereditary Spherocytosis</li>
<li>Deficiency of butyryl-CoA dehydrogenase</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  MeasureAttributeObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-MeasureAttributeObservationValue"> </a></td><td>MeasureAttributeObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Observation values used for various types of coded measure attributes in a health quality measure (eMeasure).</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    MeasureAttributeItemsCountedObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-MeasureAttributeItemsCountedObservationValue"> </a></td><td>MeasureAttributeItemsCountedObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Observation values used for an items counted measure attribute in a health quality measure (eMeasure).</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    MeasureAttributeJurisdictionObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-MeasureAttributeJurisdictionObservationValue"> </a></td><td>MeasureAttributeJurisdictionObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Observation values used for a jurisdiction measure attribute in a health quality measure (eMeasure).</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>ISO Country codes</li>
<li>State and County codes</li>
<li>FIPS value sets of postal codes</li>
<li>districts</li>
<li>regions</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    MeasureAttributeReporterTypeObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-MeasureAttributeReporterTypeObservationValue"> </a></td><td>MeasureAttributeReporterTypeObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Observation values used for a reporter type measure attribute in a health quality measure (eMeasure).</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Laboratory</li>
<li>Healthcare Providers</li>
<li>Hospitals</li>
<li>Healthcare facilities that are NOT hospitals</li>
<li>Schools</li>
<li>Pharmacists</li>
<li>Veterinary lab</li>
<li>Veterinarian</li>
<li>Prison/Jail</li>
<li>Institutions</li>
<li>Employers</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    MeasureAttributeServiceDeliveryLocationObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-MeasureAttributeServiceDeliveryLocationObservationValue"> </a></td><td>MeasureAttributeServiceDeliveryLocationObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Observation values used for a service delivery location measure attribute in a health quality measure (eMeasure).</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16927</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ObservationMeasureScoring<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationMeasureScoring"> </a></td><td>ObservationMeasureScoring</td><td><div><p>Observation values used to indicate the type of scoring (e.g. proportion, ratio) used by a health quality measure.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20367</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    ObservationMeasureType<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationMeasureType"> </a></td><td>ObservationMeasureType</td><td><div><p>Observation values used to indicate whether a health quality measure is used to sample a process or outcome over time.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20368</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ObservationCaseStatusValue<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationCaseStatusValue"> </a></td><td>ObservationCaseStatusValue</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A code used to identify the status of a case. Used with the OBS ActClass.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Suspect</li>
<li>Confirmed</li>
<li>Probable</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ObservationCriteriaValue<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationCriteriaValue"> </a></td><td>ObservationCriteriaValue</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Type of coded observation values in evaluating reference ranges.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Surgically transgendered transsexual, female-to-male</li>
<li>AIDS-associated disorder</li>
<li>Asian race</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ObservationOutbreakExtentValue<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationOutbreakExtentValue"> </a></td><td>ObservationOutbreakExtentValue</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A code used to identify the extent of an outbreak. Used with the OBS.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Local</li>
<li>Regional</li>
<li>National</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr style="background-color: #ffeeee"><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ObservationPopulationInclusionType<a name="conceptdomains-ObservationPopulationInclusionType"> </a></td><td>ObservationPopulationInclusionType</td><td><div><p>Observation values used to assert that a subject falls into a particular population.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Included in denominator</li>
<li>Included in numerator</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td>2013-07-26</td><td>deprecationEffectiveVersion=1221 coremifText=This element was deprecated as of the release indicated.</td><td>deprecated</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20369</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  PreferenceStrengthObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-PreferenceStrengthObservationValue"> </a></td><td>PreferenceStrengthObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Values that indicate how important a preference is to the target of the reporter.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Very Important</li>
<li>Important</li>
<li>Suggested</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  PublicHealthCaseObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-PublicHealthCaseObservationValue"> </a></td><td>PublicHealthCaseObservationValue</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The PublicHealthCaseObservationValue is used to identify the primary condition or disease associated with a Public Health Case.. This concept domain is intended to be used with the CASE Act class code and the ObservationInvestigationType ActCode concept domain.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Tuberculosis</li>
<li>Lyme Disease</li>
<li>SARS</li>
<li>Lung Cancer</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    OutbreakObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-OutbreakObservationValue"> </a></td><td>OutbreakObservationValue</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The OutbreakObservationValue is used to identify the primary condition or disease associated with an Outbreak. This concept domain is intended to be used with the OUTB Act class code and the ObservationPublicHealthOutbreakType ActCode concept domain.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Tuberculosis</li>
<li>Lyme Disease</li>
<li>SARS</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  SecurityObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityObservationValue"> </a></td><td>SecurityObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Observation values used to indicate security observation metadata.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Codes conveying the classification of an IT resource, such as confidentiality codes</li>
<li>Codes conveying privacy law, sensitivity, and consent directive types governing an IT resource</li>
<li>Codes conveying dissemination controls, handling caveats, purpose of use, refrain policies, and obligations to which an IT resource custodian or receiver must comply.</li>
<li>Codes conveying an IT resource completeness, veracity, reliability, trustworthiness, and provenance</li>
<li>Codes conveying the mechanism used to preserve the accuracy and consistency of an IT resource such as a digital signature and a cryptographic hash function</li>
<li>Codes conveying the mechanism used to make authorized alterations of an IT resource, such as translation, masking, and anonymization</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityObservationValue codes are members of a security label &quot;tag set&quot; used to populate or &quot;tag&quot; a security label field named by the associated SecurityObservationType code. [FIPS 188]</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20469</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SecurityCategoryObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityCategoryObservationValue"> </a></td><td>SecurityCategoryObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Security observation values used to indicate security category metadata.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Codes conveying the category of an IT resource such as:</p>
<ul>
<li>applicable privacy policy</li>
<li>sensitivity</li>
<li>consent directive type</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityCategoryObservationValue codes are members of a security label &quot;tag set&quot; used to populate or &quot;tag&quot; a security label field named by the associated SecurityCategoryObservationType code. [FIPS 188]</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20470</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SecurityClassificationObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityClassificationObservationValue"> </a></td><td>SecurityClassificationObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Security observation values used to indicate security classification metadata.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Codes conveying the classification of an IT resource, such as confidentiality codes.</p>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> SecurityClassificationObservationValue codes are members of a security label &quot;tag set&quot; used to populate or &quot;tag&quot; a security label field named by the associated SecurityClassificationObservationType code. [FIPS 188]</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20479</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SecurityControlObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityControlObservationValue"> </a></td><td>SecurityControlObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Security observation values used to indicate security control metadata.</p>

</ul>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20481</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      SecurityAlterationIntegrityObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityAlterationIntegrityObservationValue"> </a></td><td>SecurityAlterationIntegrityObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Security observation values used to indicate security alteration integrity metadata.</p>

<p>For example, applicable trust framework, policy, or mechanisms.</p>
<p><em>Usage Note:</em> Security trust metadata values may be used as the trust attribute value populating a computable trust policy, trust credential, trust assertion, or trust label field in a security label and principally used for authentication, authorization, and access control decisions.</p>
<p>SecurityTrustObservationValue may be used as a trust attribute value populating a computable trust policy, trust credential, trust assertion, or trust label field in a security label with trust observation values. The valued trust attributes may be used for used for authentication, authorization, and access control decisions. These may also be used to negotiate trust relationships, adjudicate or bridge trust policies, and to specify requirements for participation in a Trust Domain or for asserting compliance with a Trust Framework.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20538</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      SecurityTrustAccreditationObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityTrustAccreditationObservationValue"> </a></td><td>SecurityTrustAccreditationObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Values for security metadata observation made about the formal declaration by an authority or neutral third party that validates the technical, security, trust, and business practice conformance of Trust Agents to facilitate security, interoperability, and trust among participants within a security domain or trust framework.</p>
<p>For example, DirectTrust, Kantara Initiative, Open Identity</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20539</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      SecurityTrustAgreementObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityTrustAgreementObservationValue"> </a></td><td>SecurityTrustAgreementObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Values for security metadata observation made about security requirements with which a security domain must comply. [ISO IEC 10181-1] Conveys the agreement of an asserter to comply with jurisdictional, community, or contractual (security domains) codes of conduct which an information custodian requires as a condition of authorizing collection, access, use or disclosure.</p>
<p>For example, DURSA, DIRECT Applicability Statement, HIPAA Covered Entity and Business Associate Agreement, and FTC PHR Vendor, Related Entity, and third party agreements.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20544</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      SecurityTrustAssuranceObservationValue<a name="conceptdomains-SecurityTrustAssuranceObservationValue"> </a></td><td>SecurityTrustAssuranceObservationValue</td><td><div><p>Values for security metadata observation made about the digital quality or reliability of a trust assertion, activity, capability, information exchange, mechanism, process, or protocol.</p>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19903</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PayorParticipationFunction<a name="conceptdomains-PayorParticipationFunction"> </a></td><td>PayorParticipationFunction</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> Set of codes indicating the manner in which payors participate in a policy or program.&lt;/</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19906</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SponsorParticipationFunction<a name="conceptdomains-SponsorParticipationFunction"> </a></td><td>SponsorParticipationFunction</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> Set of codes indicating the manner in which sponsors participate in a policy or program. NOTE: use only when the Sponsor is not further specified with a SponsorRoleType as being either a fully insured sponsor or a self insured sponsor.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19905</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    UnderwriterParticipationFunction<a name="conceptdomains-UnderwriterParticipationFunction"> </a></td><td>UnderwriterParticipationFunction</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> Set of codes indicating the manner in which underwriters participate in a policy or program.</p>

</div></td><td>PRF</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ParticipationMode<a name="conceptdomains-ParticipationMode"> </a></td><td>ParticipationMode</td><td><div><p>Identifies a means by which an Entity participates in an Act.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16543</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ParticipationSignature<a name="conceptdomains-ParticipationSignature"> </a></td><td>ParticipationSignature</td><td><div><p>A code specifying whether and how the participant has attested his participation through a signature and or whether such a signature is needed.</p>
