</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">QueryPriority<a name="conceptdomains-QueryPriority"> </a></td><td>QueryPriority</td><td><div><p>Identifies the time frame in which the response is expected.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.91</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">QueryRequestLimit<a name="conceptdomains-QueryRequestLimit"> </a></td><td>QueryRequestLimit</td><td><div><p>Defines the units associated with the magnitude of the maximum size limit of a query response that can be accepted by the requesting application</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19911</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">QueryResponse<a name="conceptdomains-QueryResponse"> </a></td><td>QueryResponse</td><td><div><p>Values in this domain allow a query response system to return a precise response status.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.208</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">QueryStatusCode<a name="conceptdomains-QueryStatusCode"> </a></td><td>QueryStatusCode</td><td><div><p>State attributes for Query event</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.18899</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">Race<a name="conceptdomains-Race"> </a></td><td>Race</td><td><div><p>In the United States, federal standards for classifying data on race determine the categories used by federal agencies and exert a strong influence on categorization by state and local agencies and private sector organizations. The federal standards do not conceptually define race, and they recognize the absence of an anthropological or scientific basis for racial classification. Instead, the federal standards acknowledge that race is a social-political construct in which an individual's own identification with one more race categories is preferred to observer identification. The standards use a variety of features to define five minimum race categories. Among these features are descent from &quot;the original peoples&quot; of a specified region or nation. The minimum race categories are American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, and White. The federal standards stipulate that race data need not be limited to the five minimum categories, but any expansion must be collapsible to those categories.</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain definition does not align with current vocabulary practices and is much too US-centric to be appropriate as a &quot;universal&quot; domain.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14914</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">Realm<a name="conceptdomains-Realm"> </a></td><td>Realm</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> All binding realms allowed for linking concept domains to value sets.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20355</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">RelationalName<a name="conceptdomains-RelationalName"> </a></td><td>RelationalName</td><td><div><p>Provides coded names for attribute RelationalExpression.elementName, which has data type SC.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">RelationalOperator<a name="conceptdomains-RelationalOperator"> </a></td><td>RelationalOperator</td><td><div><p>Identifies common relational operators used in selection criteria.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.209</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">RelationshipConjunction<a name="conceptdomains-RelationshipConjunction"> </a></td><td>RelationshipConjunction</td><td><div><p>A code specifying the logical conjunction of the criteria among all the condition-links of Acts (e.g., and, or, exclusive-or.)</p>
<p><em>Constraints:</em> All AND criteria must be true. If OR and AND criteria occur together, one criterion out of the OR-group must be true and all AND criteria must be true also. If XOR criteria occur together with OR and AND criteria, exactly one of the XOR criteria must be true, and at least one of the OR criteria and all AND criteria must be true. In other words, the sets of AND, OR, and XOR criteria are in turn combined by a logical AND operator (all AND criteria and at least one OR criterion and exactly one XOR criterion.) To overcome this ordering, Act criteria can be nested in any way necessary.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10365</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ReligiousAffiliation<a name="conceptdomains-ReligiousAffiliation"> </a></td><td>ReligiousAffiliation</td><td><div><p>Assigment of spiritual faith affiliation</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19185</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ResponseLevel<a name="conceptdomains-ResponseLevel"> </a></td><td>ResponseLevel</td><td><div><p>Specifies whether a response is expected from the addressee of this interaction and what level of detail that response should include</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14761</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ResponseModality<a name="conceptdomains-ResponseModality"> </a></td><td>ResponseModality</td><td><div><p>Defines the timing and grouping of the response instances.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.394</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ResponseMode<a name="conceptdomains-ResponseMode"> </a></td><td>ResponseMode</td><td><div><p>Specifies the mode, immediate versus deferred or queued, by which a receiver should communicate its receiver responsibilities.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19650</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">RoleClass<a name="conceptdomains-RoleClass"> </a></td><td>RoleClass</td><td><div><p>This table includes codes for the Role class hierarchy. The values in this hierarchy, represent a Role which is an association or relationship between two entities - the entity that plays the role and the entity that scopes the role. Roles names are derived from the name of the playing entity in that role.</p>
<p>The role hierarchy stems from three core concepts, or abstract domains:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>RoleClassOntological</strong> is an abstract domain that collects roles in which the playing entity is defined or specified by the scoping entity.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>RoleClassPartitive</strong> collects roles in which the playing entity is in some sense a &quot;part&quot; of the scoping entity.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>RoleClassAssociative</strong> collects all of the remaining forms of association between the playing entity and the scoping entity. This set of roles is further partitioned between:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p><strong>RoleClassPassive</strong> which are roles in which the playing entity is used, known, treated, handled, built, or destroyed, etc. under the auspices of the scoping entity. The playing entity is passive in these roles in that the role exists without an agreement from the playing entity.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>RoleClassMutualRelationship</strong> which are relationships based on mutual behavior of the two entities. The basis of these relationship may be formal agreements or they may be <em>de facto</em> behavior. Thus, this sub-domain is further divided into:</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>RoleClassRelationshipFormal</strong> in which the relationship is formally defined, frequently by a contract or agreement.</li>
<li><strong>Personal relationship</strong> which inks two people in a personal relationship.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p>The hierarchy discussed above is represented In the current vocabulary tables as a set of abstract domains, with the exception of the &quot;Personal relationship&quot; which is a leaf concept.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.11555</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">RoleCode<a name="conceptdomains-RoleCode"> </a></td><td>RoleCode</td><td><div><p>Specific classification codes for further qualifying RoleClass codes.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  AssocativeRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-AssocativeRoleType"> </a></td><td>AssocativeRoleType</td><td><div><p>A general association between two entities that is neither partitive nor ontological.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> affiliate; agent; birthplace.</p>
</div></td><td>_RoleClassAssociative</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    MutualRelationshipRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-MutualRelationshipRoleType"> </a></td><td>MutualRelationshipRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Concepts which further characterizing the type of mutual relationships. Used only with the abstract code_RoleClassMutualRelationship.</p>
</div></td><td>_RoleClassMutualRelationship</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      AgentRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-AgentRoleType"> </a></td><td>AgentRoleType</td><td><div><p>An entity (player) that acts or is authorized to act on behalf of another entity (scoper).</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> next of kin; assigned entity; contact.</p>
</div></td><td>AGNT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        AdministrativeContactRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-AdministrativeContactRoleType"> </a></td><td>AdministrativeContactRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Indicates the role an entity (player) is playing as the appropriate contact on behalf of another entity (scoper).</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.17622</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        AssignedRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-AssignedRoleType"> </a></td><td>AssignedRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A role type that is used to further qualify an entity playing a role where the role class attribute is set to RoleClass AssignedEntity. The suggested values from V2.x include clinic receptionist, referral agent, staff physician, courtesy physician, resident, physician assistant, physical therapist, psychiatrist, psychologist, pharmacist, registered nurse, licensed practical nurse, licensed vocational nurse, nurse practitioner, etc.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Janitor</li>
<li>Chief of Staff</li>
<li>Referral Agent</li>
<li>Security Guard</li>
<li>ICU Runner</li>
<li>Visiting professor</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Open Issue:</em> There needs to be work undertaken to clean up the hierarchy under this Domain as there seems to be some muddling between D:ProductLifecycleAssginedRoleType and D:ClinicalOrganizationRoleType and this new D:AssignedNonLivingSubjectRoleType. There may be other issues that need improvement in this hierarchy, and there may be some issue with the corresponding hierarchy in the code system. (identified in 11/2014 cycle)</p>
</div></td><td>ASSIGNED</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          AssignedNonLivingSubjectRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-AssignedNonLivingSubjectRoleType"> </a></td><td>AssignedNonLivingSubjectRoleType</td><td><div><p>A role type that is used to further qualify an inanimate subject playing a role where the playing entity acts or is authorized to act on behalf of a scoping entity.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Assistive device for impaired or challenged person</li>
<li>Non-living entities that may participate as assigned therapeutic agents</li>
<li>Entities that may be provided to patients to improve general mood, decrease depression and loneliness, and distract from stress-inducing concerns to improve quality of life.</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ASSIGNED</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>7</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">            ProvenanceAssignedDeviceRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-ProvenanceAssignedDeviceRoleType"> </a></td><td>ProvenanceAssignedDeviceRoleType</td><td><div><p>A role type, which indicates the type of device that authors or in some manner contributes to the generation, management, and/or transmission of health information, the use of which may be tracked for purposes of determining the provenance of health information. The playing device acts or is authorized to act on behalf of a scoping entity..</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Patient selected home monitoring device e.g., to detect and report falls</li>
<li>Provider selected medication adherence monitoring, reporting, and alerting device</li>
<li>Provider designated EKG measuring and reporting device</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ASSIGNED</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          AssignedNonPersonLivingSubjectRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-AssignedNonPersonLivingSubjectRoleType"> </a></td><td>AssignedNonPersonLivingSubjectRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**A role type that is used to further qualify a non-person subject playing a role where the role class attribute is set to RoleClass AssignedEntity</p>
<p><em>Open Issue:</em> The definition should be modified to clarify the fact that it is a living non-person subject. (AK 11/2014 cycle)</p>
</div></td><td>ASSIGNED</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19869</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          ClinicalOrganizationRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-ClinicalOrganizationRoleType"> </a></td><td>ClinicalOrganizationRoleType</td><td><div><p>A role of an organization that further classifies the clincial responsibility for the healthcare care delivered during an encounter. E.g. cardiology service, pediatric service, nursing services.</p>
</div></td><td>ASSIGNED</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          CommissioningPartyRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-CommissioningPartyRoleType"> </a></td><td>CommissioningPartyRoleType</td><td><div><p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain has <strong>no valid description</strong>.</p>
</div></td><td>COMPAR</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>7</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">            GrantorRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-GrantorRoleType"> </a></td><td>GrantorRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The specific kinds of roles that issue information privacy grants that permit or prohibit potential actions on information artifacts.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Parent</li>
<li>Legal Guardian</li>
<li>Health Information Exchange</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ASSIGNED</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>8</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">              GrantorOrganizationRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-GrantorOrganizationRoleType"> </a></td><td>GrantorOrganizationRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The specific kinds of organizational roles that issue information privacy grants that permit or prohibit potential actions on information artifacts.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Clearinghouse</li>
<li>Billing Service</li>
<li>Health Information Exchange</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>8</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">              GrantorPersonRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-GrantorPersonRoleType"> </a></td><td>GrantorPersonRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> The specific kinds of person roles that issue information privacy grants that permit or prohibit potential actions on information artifacts.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Self</li>
<li>Parent</li>
<li>Legal Guardian</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          DeviceOperatorType<a name="conceptdomains-DeviceOperatorType"> </a></td><td>DeviceOperatorType</td><td><div><p>Indicates the type of person that is responsible for operating the device related to the incident reported in ICSR.</p>
<p>Examples include: Physician, Nurse, Medical Technician, Respiratory Technician.</p>
</div></td><td>ASSIGNED</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          HealthcareProviderRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-HealthcareProviderRoleType"> </a></td><td>HealthcareProviderRoleType</td><td><div><p>A role type that is used to categorize an entity that delivers health care in an expected and professional manner to a subject in need of health care services.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Registered Nurse</li>
<li>Physician</li>
<li>Custodial Care Clinic</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ASSIGNED</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19465</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>7</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">            LabSpecimenCollectionProviders<a name="conceptdomains-LabSpecimenCollectionProviders"> </a></td><td>LabSpecimenCollectionProviders</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Providers used in Laboratory messaging.</p>
</div></td><td>PROV</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19748</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          ICSRReportingRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-ICSRReportingRoleType"> </a></td><td>ICSRReportingRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A role that is played by a party which is involved in the process originating or managing reports of adverse events or product problems.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Marketing Authorization Holder</li>
<li>Regulatory Agency</li>
<li>Healthcare Practitioner</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ASSIGNED</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          PersonalAndLegalAssignedRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-PersonalAndLegalAssignedRoleType"> </a></td><td>PersonalAndLegalAssignedRoleType</td><td><div><p>A &quot;personal and legal&quot; assigned relationship records the role of a person in relation to another person, or a person to himself or herself. These concepts are to be used when recording relationships based on personal or family ties or through legal assignment of responsibility.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.11.20.12.1</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          ProductLifecycleAssignedRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-ProductLifecycleAssignedRoleType"> </a></td><td>ProductLifecycleAssignedRoleType</td><td><div><p>A code specifying a type of responsibility that an entity may take on with respect the lifecycle of a product.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Manufacturer</li>
<li>Distributor</li>
<li>Retailer</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ContactRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-ContactRoleType"> </a></td><td>ContactRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A role type that is used to further qualify or describe the role of the contact person or organization.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Legal representative</li>
<li>Primary contact</li>
<li>Alternative contact</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>CON</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.15920</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        GuardianRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-GuardianRoleType"> </a></td><td>GuardianRoleType</td><td><div><p>Qualify the holder or scope of a guardianship relationship over a living subject.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Guardianship held jointly by separated parents</li>
<li>Guardianship held jointly by parent and another person</li>
<li>Natural guardian</li>
<li>Special guardian</li>
<li>Guardian of property</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>GUARD</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ProductSafetyReportPartyRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-ProductSafetyReportPartyRoleType"> </a></td><td>ProductSafetyReportPartyRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Captures the different roles that are recorded to characterize the qualifications or stations in life of persons or organizations who participate as senders or as receivers of adverse event or product problem reports.</p>
<p>**Example:**Example values may include: physician, healthcare facility, attorney, family member, regulatory agency. Initial effort to find defined concepts for this value set will focus on the HIPAA provider taxonomy.</p>
</div></td><td>AGNT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      FormalRelationshipRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-FormalRelationshipRoleType"> </a></td><td>FormalRelationshipRoleType</td><td><div><p>A relationship between two entities that is formally recognized, frequently by a contract or similar agreement.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> agent; guarantor; patient.</p>
</div></td><td>_RoleClassRelationshipFormal</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        AffiliationRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-AffiliationRoleType"> </a></td><td>AffiliationRoleType</td><td><div><p>Concepts characterizing the type of association formed by player and scoper when there is a recognized Affiliate role by which the two parties are related.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> Business Partner, Business Associate, Colleague</p>
</div></td><td>AFFL</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          CoverageSponsorRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-CoverageSponsorRoleType"> </a></td><td>CoverageSponsorRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Codes that indicate a specific type of sponsor. Used when the sponsor's role is only either as a fully insured sponsor or only as a self-insured sponsor. NOTE: Where a sponsor may be either, use the SponsorParticipationFunction.code (fully insured or self insured) to indicate the type of responsibility. (CO6-0057)</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19877</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          PayorRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-PayorRoleType"> </a></td><td>PayorRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**PayorRoleType for a particular type of policy or program benefit package or plan where more detail about the coverage administration role of the Payor is required. The functions performed by a Payor qualified by a PayorRoleType may be specified by the PayorParticpationFunction value set.</p>
<p>**Examples:**A Payor that is a TPA may administer a managed care plan without underwriting the risk.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19853</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          ResponsibleParty<a name="conceptdomains-ResponsibleParty"> </a></td><td>ResponsibleParty</td><td><div><p>The role played by a party who has legal responsibility for another party.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19830</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>7</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">            PowerOfAttorney<a name="conceptdomains-PowerOfAttorney"> </a></td><td>PowerOfAttorney</td><td><div><p>A relationship between two people in which one person authorizes another to act for him in a manner which is a legally binding upon the person giving such authority as if he or she personally were to do the acts.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19831</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        CitizenRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-CitizenRoleType"> </a></td><td>CitizenRoleType</td><td><div><p>A role type used to qualify a person's legal status within a country or nation.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Full citizen</li>
<li>Asylum seeker</li>
<li>Permit card holder</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>CIT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20371</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        CoveredPartyRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-CoveredPartyRoleType"> </a></td><td>CoveredPartyRoleType</td><td><div><p>A role recognized through the eligibility of an identified living subject for benefits covered under an insurance policy or a program. Eligibility as a covered party may be conditioned on a relationship with (1) the policy holder such as the policy holder who is covered as an individual under a poliy or as a party sponsored for coverage by the policy holder.</p>
<p>**Example:**An employee as a subscriber; or (2) on being scoped another covered party such as the subscriber, as in the case of a dependent.</p>
<p><strong>Discussion:</strong> The Abstract Value Set &quot;CoverageRoleType&quot;, which was developed for use in the Canadian realm &quot;pre-coordinate&quot; coverage roles with other roles that a covered party must play in order to be eligible for coverage, e.g., &quot;handicapped dependent&quot;. Other codes in the Abstract Value Set CoveredPartyRoleType domain can be &quot;post-coordinated&quot; with the EligiblePartyRoleType codes to denote comparable concepts. Decoupling the concepts is intended to support a wider range of concepts and semantic comparability of coded concepts.</p>
</div></td><td>COVPTY</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19805</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          StudentRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-StudentRoleType"> </a></td><td>StudentRoleType</td><td><div><p>Type of role attendance the covered party has at a recognized educational institution as defined by a particular insurance policy.</p>
</div></td><td>NAMED</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19671</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        EmployeeRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-EmployeeRoleType"> </a></td><td>EmployeeRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A role type that is used to further qualify an entity playing a role where the role class attribute is set to RoleClass Employee. This specifies the relationship the staff person has with the institution for whom he/she provides services.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Employee</li>
<li>Volunteer</li>
<li>Consultant</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>EMP</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        InvestigatedSubjectRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-InvestigatedSubjectRoleType"> </a></td><td>InvestigatedSubjectRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A code further classifying the type of investigated subject role. Used with the INVSBJ role class code.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Case subject</li>
<li>Suspect</li>
<li>Person of interest</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>INVSBJ</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          ResearchSubjectRoleBasis<a name="conceptdomains-ResearchSubjectRoleBasis"> </a></td><td>ResearchSubjectRoleBasis</td><td><div><p>Specifies the administrative functionality within a formal experimental design for which the ResearchSubject role was established. Examples: screening - role is used for pre-enrollment evaluation portion of the design; enrolled - role is used for subjects admitted to the active treatment portion of the design.</p>
</div></td><td>RESBJ</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19417</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        LicensedRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-LicensedRoleType"> </a></td><td>LicensedRoleType</td><td><div><p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain has <strong>no valid description</strong>.</p>
</div></td><td>LIC</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          ProviderCodes<a name="conceptdomains-ProviderCodes"> </a></td><td>ProviderCodes</td><td><div><p>Healthcare Provider Taxonomy Codes</p>
</div></td><td>PROV</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19465</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        QualifiedRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-QualifiedRoleType"> </a></td><td>QualifiedRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A category to which a person can be assigned on the basis of professional qualification, experience, and/or job assignment.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Physician</li>
<li>Registered Nurse</li>
<li>Product Quality Manager</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>QUAL</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          CertifiedEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-CertifiedEntityType"> </a></td><td>CertifiedEntityType</td><td><div><p>Defines types of certifications for all entities</p>
</div></td><td>QUAL</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>7</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">            PractitionerCertifiedEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-PractitionerCertifiedEntityType"> </a></td><td>PractitionerCertifiedEntityType</td><td><div><p>Defines types of certifications for practitioners</p>
<p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain should be reviewed to determine whether it needs a &quot;ConceptualSpaceForClassCode&quot; property to link to a RIM classCode.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      PersonalRelationshipRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-PersonalRelationshipRoleType"> </a></td><td>PersonalRelationshipRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Types of personal relationships between two living subjects.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Parent</li>
<li>sibling</li>
<li>unrelated friend</li>
<li>neighbor</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>PRS</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19563</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        FamilyMemberRelationshipRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-FamilyMemberRelationshipRoleType"> </a></td><td>FamilyMemberRelationshipRoleType</td><td><div><p>The type of familial relationship between a living subject and another living subject.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Father</li>
<li>Mother</li>
<li>Uncle</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19579</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PassiveRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-PassiveRoleType"> </a></td><td>PassiveRoleType</td><td><div><p>An association for a playing Entity that is used, known, treated, handled, built, or destroyed, etc. under the auspices of the scoping Entity. The playing Entity is passive in these roles (even though it may be active in other roles), in the sense that the kinds of things done to it in this role happen without an agreement from the playing Entity.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> birthplace; owned entity; used entity.</p>
</div></td><td>_RoleClassPassive</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      AdministrativeLocationRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-AdministrativeLocationRoleType"> </a></td><td>AdministrativeLocationRoleType</td><td><div><p><em>OpenIssue:</em> This concept domain has <strong>no valid description</strong>.</p>
</div></td><td>_RoleClassPassive</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      HealthcareServiceLocation<a name="conceptdomains-HealthcareServiceLocation"> </a></td><td>HealthcareServiceLocation</td><td><div><p>A set of concepts representing locations and settings where healthcare services are provided.</p>
</div></td><td>SDLOC</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20275</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        DedicatedServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-DedicatedServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType"> </a></td><td>DedicatedServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType</td><td><div><p>A role of a place that further classifies a setting that is intended to house the provision of services.</p>
</div></td><td>DSDLOC</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19450</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        IncidentalServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-IncidentalServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType"> </a></td><td>IncidentalServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType</td><td><div><p>Types of locations,that are not designed for the purpose of providing health care services but where care provision takes place.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Accident site</li>
<li>Patient's residence</li>
<li>School</li>
<li>Work site</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>ISDLOC</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19451</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      IdentifiedEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-IdentifiedEntityType"> </a></td><td>IdentifiedEntityType</td><td><div><p><strong>Definition:</strong> A code representing the type of identifier that has been assigned to the identified entity (IDENT).</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Example values include Social Insurance Number, Product Catalog ID, Product Model Number.</p>
</div></td><td>IDENT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        LocationIdentifiedEntityRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-LocationIdentifiedEntityRoleType"> </a></td><td>LocationIdentifiedEntityRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Describes types of identifiers other than the primary location registry identifier for a service delivery location. Identifiers may be assigned by a local service delivery organization, a formal body capable of accrediting the location for the capability to provide specific services or the identifier may be assigned at a jurisdictional level.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20422</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        PersonIdentifierRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-PersonIdentifierRoleType"> </a></td><td>PersonIdentifierRoleType</td><td><div><p>Types of identifiers for persons.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Social insurance number</li>
<li>Passport number</li>
<li>Drivers license number</li>
<li>Jurisdiction health number</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        SpecimenIdentifierRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-SpecimenIdentifierRoleType"> </a></td><td>SpecimenIdentifierRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> A role by which one can communicate additional identifiers for a specimen.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>specimen identifier</li>
<li>accession identifier</li>
<li>container identifier</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>IDENT</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      MolecularBondRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-MolecularBondRoleType"> </a></td><td>MolecularBondRoleType</td><td><div><p>The nature of the bonds by which two molecular parts may be connected.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> (1) simple bonds such as, single bond, double bond, triple bond, (2) specialized bonds such as peptide bond, disulfide bond, etc., (3) weak bonds such as van-der-Waals, chelate, and ion-associations.</p>
</div></td><td>BOND</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      MolecularFeatureRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-MolecularFeatureRoleType"> </a></td><td>MolecularFeatureRoleType</td><td><div><p>The generalization of molecular parts (partitive role) and molecular bonds (associative role), or possibly any other role type used for the expression of structural molecular features.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> (1) acetyl group (a moiety), (2) disulfide bond (a bond), (3) O-linked glycosylation (a moiety).</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      NDCRelatedDrugEntityType<a name="conceptdomains-NDCRelatedDrugEntityType"> </a></td><td>NDCRelatedDrugEntityType</td><td><div><p>NDC Regulated Drug Entity Type</p>
</div></td><td>RGPR</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ProductProcessingOrganizationRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-ProductProcessingOrganizationRoleType"> </a></td><td>ProductProcessingOrganizationRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Indicates the role that an organization takes in the process by which a product goes from an original manufacturer to the eventual consumer.</p>
<p>**Examples:**Manufacturer, re-processor</p>
<p>**Note:**These two values are currently used in adverse event and product problem reporting.</p>
</div></td><td>MANU</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ProductRegulatoryServicesLocationRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-ProductRegulatoryServicesLocationRoleType"> </a></td><td>ProductRegulatoryServicesLocationRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Provides the description of the role of a place in terms of its provision of services and functions in the product regulatory domain.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>pharmacovigilance masterfile location</li>
<li>COSHH (Control of Substances Hazardous to Health) masterfile location</li>
<li>regulatory dossier storage location</li>
<li>batch release masterfile location</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ProductRelatedRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-ProductRelatedRoleType"> </a></td><td>ProductRelatedRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Concepts characterizing product related roles.</p>
</div></td><td>_RoleClassPassive</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        DistributedMaterialRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-DistributedMaterialRoleType"> </a></td><td>DistributedMaterialRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Codes that further characterize the distribution of a material. Used only with the DST (distributed material) role classCode.</p>
<p>**Examples:**Intensive distribution, Selective distribution and Exclusive distribution.</p>
</div></td><td>DST</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        ManufacturedProductRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-ManufacturedProductRoleType"> </a></td><td>ManufacturedProductRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**A role type that is used to further qualify an entity playing a role where the role class attribute is set to RoleClass ManufacturedProduct.</p>
</div></td><td>MANU</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>6</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">          VisionProductRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-VisionProductRoleType"> </a></td><td>VisionProductRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**A role type that is used to further qualify an entity playing a role where the role is that of a vision product such as lenses, frames, etc.</p>
</div></td><td>MANU</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        RegulatedProductRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-RegulatedProductRoleType"> </a></td><td>RegulatedProductRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Codes that further characterize a regulated product role. Used only with the RGPR (regulated product) role classCode.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> Regulated drug and regulated device.</p>
</div></td><td>RGPR</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        RetailedMaterialRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-RetailedMaterialRoleType"> </a></td><td>RetailedMaterialRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Codes that further characterize the association of a material playing the role of a retailed material to the scoper which retails the material. Used only with the RET (retailed material) role classCode.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Department store, Self-service and Online.</p>
</div></td><td>RET</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        TheraputicAgentRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-TheraputicAgentRoleType"> </a></td><td>TheraputicAgentRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Codes that further characterize the Theraputic Agent as a manufactured product. Used only with the THER (therapeutic agent) role classCode.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Generic and Brand name.</p>
</div></td><td>THER</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>5</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">        WarrantedProductRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-WarrantedProductRoleType"> </a></td><td>WarrantedProductRoleType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Codes that further characterize a warranted product role. Used only with the WRTE (warranted product) role classCode.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> Express warranty, Implied Warranty and Lifetime Warranty.</p>
</div></td><td>WRTE</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      ProvenancePassiveDeviceRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-ProvenancePassiveDeviceRoleType"> </a></td><td>ProvenancePassiveDeviceRoleType</td><td><div><p>A role type, which indicates the type of device that in some manner contributes to the generation, management, and/or transmission of health information, the use of which may be tracked for purposes of determining the provenance of health information. The playing device is passive in these roles in the sense that the device is not authorized to act on behalf of a scoping entity.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Software that aggregates pre-existing content to facilitate the authorship of a new artifact by an assigned entity</li>
<li>Software that translates pre-existing content to facilitate the management of that content by an assigned entity</li>
<li>Software that transmits content to facilitate the exchange of that content by an assigned entity</li>
<li>Privacy protective software that facilitates privacy protection and security enforcement by filtering health information and applying protections such as de-identification, masking, or redaction, and privacy marking.</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>_RoleClassPassive</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      RoleAccessType<a name="conceptdomains-RoleAccessType"> </a></td><td>RoleAccessType</td><td><div><p>Type of material that provides access to another entity.</p>
</div></td><td>ACCESS</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      TerritorialAuthorityRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-TerritorialAuthorityRoleType"> </a></td><td>TerritorialAuthorityRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Concepts which further characterizing the type of territorial authority. Used only with the TERR (territorial authority) role classCode.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> public health authority, judicial authority and national authority.</p>
</div></td><td>TERR</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  ICSRParticipantRoleQualificationType<a name="conceptdomains-ICSRParticipantRoleQualificationType"> </a></td><td>ICSRParticipantRoleQualificationType</td><td><div><p>**Description:**Different types of qualification that could be applicable for a party involved in sending or receiving a case safety report, providing the original notification or report of an adverse event or product problem.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Physician</li>
<li>Veterinarian</li>
<li>Lawyer</li>
<li>Member of the public</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>QUAL</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  IDMPRoleCodeType<a name="conceptdomains-IDMPRoleCodeType"> </a></td><td>IDMPRoleCodeType</td><td><div><p>Defines elements of the IDMP model, whether concepts defined by role, or relationships between concepts defined by role, that cannot otherwise easily be distinguished within the Common Product Model structures and associated vocabulary. This domain is a collector for the different types of semantics associated with the IDMP role concept spaces.</p>
</div></td><td>ROL</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    IDMPProductType<a name="conceptdomains-IDMPProductType"> </a></td><td>IDMPProductType</td><td><div><p>Provides a set of values for defining the type of Pharmaceutical Product that is related to a PhPID. This in turn determines the type of information that may be conveyed when using the Common Product Model as a vehicle for IDMP model data.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Chemical Type</li>
<li>Radionuclides (radioactive) Type</li>
<li>Biological Substance</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    IDMPRelationType<a name="conceptdomains-IDMPRelationType"> </a></td><td>IDMPRelationType</td><td><div><p>Provides a set of values for defining the relationship between different concepts when using the Common Product Model as a vehicle for IDMP model data</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Medicinal identifier</li>
<li>Pharmaceutical identifier</li>
<li>Underlying pharmaceutical concept identifier</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  OntologicalRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-OntologicalRoleType"> </a></td><td>OntologicalRoleType</td><td><div><p>A relationship in which the scoping Entity defines or specifies what the playing Entity is. Thus, the player's &quot;being&quot; (Greek: ontos) is specified.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> sameness; instance; generalization.</p>
</div></td><td>_RoleClassOntological</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    EquivalenceEvaluationRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-EquivalenceEvaluationRoleType"> </a></td><td>EquivalenceEvaluationRoleType</td><td><div><p>A code specifying in what way two products are considered equivalent. One example for a value set in the US can be found in U.S. FDA &quot;Orange Book&quot; at the FDA website but the concept is universal and not a U.S. only issue.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>No known or suspected bioequivalence problems</li>
<li>Potential bioequivalence problems have been resolved with evidence supporting bioequivalence</li>
<li>Bioequivalence problems have not been fully resolved</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td>EQUIV</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    MedicationGeneralizationRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-MedicationGeneralizationRoleType"> </a></td><td>MedicationGeneralizationRoleType</td><td><div><p>Identifies the specific hierarchical relationship between the playing and scoping medications.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> Generic, Generic Formulation, Therapeutic Class, etc.</p>
</div></td><td>GEN</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19720</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>2</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">  PartitiveRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-PartitiveRoleType"> </a></td><td>PartitiveRoleType</td><td><div><p>An association between two Entities where the playing Entity is considered in some way &quot;part&quot; of the scoping Entity, e.g., as a member, component, ingredient, or content. Being &quot;part&quot; in the broadest sense of the word can mean anything from being an integral structural component to a mere incidental temporary association of a playing Entity with a (generally larger) scoping Entity.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> part; member; ingredient.</p>
</div></td><td>_RoleClassPartitive</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    LocatedEntityRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-LocatedEntityRoleType"> </a></td><td>LocatedEntityRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Constrains the concepts used to further characterize the association between an entity and itaTMs location. Used only with the LOCE (located entity) role classCode.</p>
<p><strong>Example:</strong> home, business and vacation home.</p>
</div></td><td>LOCE</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    MemberRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-MemberRoleType"> </a></td><td>MemberRoleType</td><td><div><p>A classification for further qualifying an entity playing a Member RoleClass.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ul>
<li>tribal member</li>
<li>elected member</li>
<li><em>ex officio</em> member</li>
<li>part-time member</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.15925</td><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    PartRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-PartRoleType"> </a></td><td>PartRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Concepts which further characterizing the association two Entities where the playing Entity (the part) is a component of the whole (scoper). Used only with the PART (part) role classCode.</p>
<p>Example: Body part, organization part and moiety.</p>
</div></td><td>PART</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      MolecularPartRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-MolecularPartRoleType"> </a></td><td>MolecularPartRoleType</td><td><div><p>The senses in which a molecule may be conceptually or actually divided into parts.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em></p>
<ol>
<li>sub-unit of a protein (i.e., sequences held together usually by disulfide bonds);</li>
<li>domain of a protein or component of a nucleic acid sequence (i.e., a sub-sequence identified to have a certain folding structure or function, e.g. signaling peptide of a protein precursor or promoter and open reading frame of a nucleic acid);</li>
<li>residue on a molecular base skeleton; atom of a molecule (e.g., to identify substitution with a radioactive isotope);</li>
<li>dissociable ion.</li>
</ol>
<p><em>UsageNotes:</em> The specific code system and concepts are left to be externally defined. However, when the positionNumber attribute is to be used with the part role to indicate where the part is placed, the part role code must specify how the position number vector is to be interpreted. For example, for subunits of a protein oligomer (such as fibrinogen) held together by disulfide bonds, the part relationship would need to specify the position of the links</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>The specific code system and concepts are left to be externally defined. However, when the positionNumber attribute is to be used with the part role to indicate where the part is placed, the part role code must specify how the position number vector is to be interpreted. For example, for subunits of a protein oligomer (such as fibrinogen) held together by disulfide bonds, the part relationship would need to specify the position of the links</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      OrganizationPartRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-OrganizationPartRoleType"> </a></td><td>OrganizationPartRoleType</td><td><div><p>Concepts which further characterize the association between two Entities which are organizations where the playing Entity (the part) is a component of the whole (scoper). Used only with the PART (part) role classCode.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>business unit</li>
<li>department</li>
<li>executive team</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>3</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">    SpecimenRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-SpecimenRoleType"> </a></td><td>SpecimenRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Further classifies the types of specimen roles.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Examples include Quality control specimens, grouped specimens and patient specimens.</p>
</div></td><td>SPEC</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16515</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>4</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">      DerivedSpecimenRoleType<a name="conceptdomains-DerivedSpecimenRoleType"> </a></td><td>DerivedSpecimenRoleType</td><td><div><p><strong>Description:</strong> Specimen types which further classify the types of specimens that are derived from other specimens.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong> Examples include specimen sections and specimen components.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">RoleLinkStatus<a name="conceptdomains-RoleLinkStatus"> </a></td><td>RoleLinkStatus</td><td><div><p>**Description:**The status of an instance of the RIM RoleLink class.</p>
<p><strong>Constraint:</strong> It is intended to be used based on usage of the ParticipationType concept domain.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Active</li>
<li>No longer active</li>
<li>Nullified</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.20413</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">RoleLinkType<a name="conceptdomains-RoleLinkType"> </a></td><td>RoleLinkType</td><td><div><p>A code specifying the kind of connection represented by this RoleLink, e.g., has-part, has-authority.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.11603</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">RoleStatus<a name="conceptdomains-RoleStatus"> </a></td><td>RoleStatus</td><td><div><p>The status of an instance of the RIM Role class.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.15999</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">RouteOfAdministration<a name="conceptdomains-RouteOfAdministration"> </a></td><td>RouteOfAdministration</td><td><div><p>**Description:**This describes which path the administered medication takes to get into the body or into contact with the body and constitutes part of the <em>where</em> (the other part being site - see below). It is the <em>way in</em> or the course the medication must take to get to its destination.</p>
<p>Note that a path is in no sense a description of a <em>final destination</em>; it is a stylized description of the path taken. For example, an oral antibiotic may be used to treat a severe infection on a toe; the oral route is used to get the medicine to be able to reach and treat the infection in the toe. For some specific routes of administration there may be an incidental sense of <em>final destination</em>, for example an ocular administration usually occurs when treatment of an eye condition is required. However, this is in no sense definitional: rectal administration of a medicine may be for a local effect (a steroid foam for treatment of colitis) or for a systemic effect (metronidazole for treatment of infection). The route of administration of a medicine should only be a description of the path taken and not the form.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>oral</li>
<li>rectal</li>
<li>intravenous (IV)</li>
<li>subcutaneous (SC)</li>
<li>intramuscular (IM)</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14581</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">Sequencing<a name="conceptdomains-Sequencing"> </a></td><td>Sequencing</td><td><div><p><strong>DESCRIPTION:</strong></p>
<p>Specifies direction of sort.</p>
<p><strong>Examples:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Ascending</li>
<li>Descending</li>
<li>None</li>
</ul>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.390</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">SetOperator<a name="conceptdomains-SetOperator"> </a></td><td>SetOperator</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.17416</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">SoftwareName<a name="conceptdomains-SoftwareName"> </a></td><td>SoftwareName</td><td><div><p>Provides coded names for attribute Device.softwareName, which has data type SC.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">SpecialArrangement<a name="conceptdomains-SpecialArrangement"> </a></td><td>SpecialArrangement</td><td><div><p>A code indicating the type of special arrangements provided for a patient encounter (e.g., wheelchair, stretcher, interpreter, attendant, seeing eye dog). For encounters in intention moods, this information can be used to identify special arrangements that will need to be made for the incoming patient.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">StyleType<a name="conceptdomains-StyleType"> </a></td><td>StyleType</td><td><div><p>(abstract) Used within an instance to give the author some control over various aspects of rendering</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.19602</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">SubstitutionCondition<a name="conceptdomains-SubstitutionCondition"> </a></td><td>SubstitutionCondition</td><td><div><p>Identifies what sort of change is permitted or has occurred between the item that was ordered/requested and the one that was/will be provided.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.17719</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">TableCellHorizontalAlign<a name="conceptdomains-TableCellHorizontalAlign"> </a></td><td>TableCellHorizontalAlign</td><td><div><p>These values are defined within the XHTML 4.0 Table Model</p>

</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.11002</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">TargetAwareness<a name="conceptdomains-TargetAwareness"> </a></td><td>TargetAwareness</td><td><div><p>A code specifying the extent to which the Entity playing the participating Role (usually as a target Participation) is aware of the associated Act.</p>
<p><em>Examples:</em> For diagnostic observations, is the patient, family member or other participant aware of his terminal illness?</p>
<p><em>Discussion:</em> If the awareness, denial, unconsciousness, etc. is the subject of medical considerations (e.g., part of the problem list), one should use explicit observations in these matters as well, and should not solely rely on this simple attribute in the Participation.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CWE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.10310</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">TelecommunicationAddressUse<a name="conceptdomains-TelecommunicationAddressUse"> </a></td><td>TelecommunicationAddressUse</td><td><div><p>**** MISSING DEFINITIONS ****</p>

The URL specifies the protocol and the contact point defined by that protocol for the resource.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>2020-01-01</td><td>CNE</td><td>2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14866</td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v3</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AdministrativeSex<a name="conceptdomains-AdministrativeSex"> </a></td><td>Administrative Sex (0001)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for a patient's sex.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">V2MaritalStatus<a name="conceptdomains-V2MaritalStatus"> </a></td><td>Marital Status (0002)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for a person's marital (civil/legal) status.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">EventType<a name="conceptdomains-EventType"> </a></td><td>Event Type (0003)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the trigger event for Version 2.x interface messages.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">PatientClass<a name="conceptdomains-PatientClass"> </a></td><td>Patient Class (0004)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values that systems to categorize patients by site in HL7 Version 2.x interfaces.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">V2Race<a name="conceptdomains-V2Race"> </a></td><td>Race (0005)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the patient's race.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">Religion<a name="conceptdomains-Religion"> </a></td><td>Religion (0006)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for a person's religion.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AdmissionType<a name="conceptdomains-AdmissionType"> </a></td><td>Admission Type (0007)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the circumstances under which the patient was or will be admitted.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AcknowledgmentCode<a name="conceptdomains-AcknowledgmentCode"> </a></td><td>Acknowledgment code (0008)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for acknowledgment codes used in Version 2.x message.  For details of usage, see message processing rules in the published Standard.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AmbulatoryStatus<a name="conceptdomains-AmbulatoryStatus"> </a></td><td>Ambulatory Status (0009)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for permanent or transient handicapped conditions of a person.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">TransactionType<a name="conceptdomains-TransactionType"> </a></td><td>Transaction Type (0017)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for a type of financial transaction.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">PatientType<a name="conceptdomains-PatientType"> </a></td><td>Patient Type (0018)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the patient type.  No suggested values.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AnesthesiaCode<a name="conceptdomains-AnesthesiaCode"> </a></td><td>Anesthesia Code (0019)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the anesthesia used during the procedure.  No suggested values.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">BadDebtAgencyCode<a name="conceptdomains-BadDebtAgencyCode"> </a></td><td>Bad Debt Agency Code (0021)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the bad debt agency to which the account was transferred.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">BillingStatus<a name="conceptdomains-BillingStatus"> </a></td><td>Billing Status (0022)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for whether the particular insurance has been billed and, if so, the type of bill.  No suggested values.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">AdmitSource<a name="conceptdomains-AdmitSource"> </a></td><td>Admit Source (0023)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for where the patient was admitted.  No suggested values.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">FeeSchedule<a name="conceptdomains-FeeSchedule"> </a></td><td>Fee Schedule (0024)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the appropriate fee schedule to be used for this transaction posting.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">Priority<a name="conceptdomains-Priority"> </a></td><td>Priority (0027)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the allowed priorities for obtaining the specimen.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">Charge_PriceIndicator<a name="conceptdomains-Charge_PriceIndicator"> </a></td><td>Charge/Price Indicator (0032)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for which price schedule is to be used for room and bed charges.  No suggested values.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">OrderStatus<a name="conceptdomains-OrderStatus"> </a></td><td>Order status (0038)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the status of an order. The purpose of these values are to report the status of an order either upon request (solicited), or when the status changes (unsolicited). The values are not intended to initiate action.  It is assumed that the order status value always reflects the status as it is known to the sending application at the time that a message is sent.  Only the filler can originate these values.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">CompanyPlanCode<a name="conceptdomains-CompanyPlanCode"> </a></td><td>Company Plan Code (0042)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for an insurance company plan uniquely.  No suggested values.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ConditionCode<a name="conceptdomains-ConditionCode"> </a></td><td>Condition Code (0043)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the condition code.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">ContractCode<a name="conceptdomains-ContractCode"> </a></td><td>Contract Code (0044)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the type of contract entered into by the healthcare facility and the guarantor for the purpose of settling outstanding account balances.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">CourtesyCode<a name="conceptdomains-CourtesyCode"> </a></td><td>Courtesy Code (0045)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for whether the patient will be extended certain special courtesies.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">CreditRating<a name="conceptdomains-CreditRating"> </a></td><td>Credit Rating (0046)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for past credit experience.</p>
</div></td><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td/><td>v2</td><td/></tr><tr><td>1</td><td style="white-space:nowrap">DepartmentCode<a name="conceptdomains-DepartmentCode"> </a></td><td>Department Code (0049)</td><td><div><p>The domain of possible values for the department that controls a specified transaction code.</p>
